title: Internal Audit Manager
company: NOVARTIS ASIA PACIFIC PHARMACEUTICALS PTE. LTD.
company_info: NOVARTIS ASIA PACIFIC PHARMACEUTICALS PTE. LTD.
address: MAPLETREE BUSINESS CITY, 20 PASIR PANJANG ROAD 117439
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
105,000! unique individuals work at Novartis, all with different needs and aspirations, aligned to a single inspirational purpose; to Reimagine Medicine for millions of patients around the world.

You will have opportunities to help improving governance, risk management, processes and our culture, and to engage with senior leaders of Novartis Corporate functions and country organizations. You will also be able to further develop your skills and strengths that will help you to reach new heights and to find professional fulfillment in an inspired, curious and unbossed organization.
We are looking for an Internal Auditor Manager in the APAC team to be a trusted partner who keeps Novartis’ patients, associates, customers, assets, and reputation safe, and who helps Novartis be successful in reimagining medicine.

Key Responsibilities

• Plan, deliver and follow up from assurance and advisory projects in the APAC markets and at the corporate level as a team member.
• Identify the root causes of audit findings and investigate, analyse and recommend practical solutions to prevent re-occurrence.
• Contribute to the digital transformation of the audit function to leverage the opportunities presented by current and new technologies and date across the organisations.
• Act as a cultural change agents who supports the creation of an inspired, curious and unbossed organisation.
• Manage knowledge and drive innovation to ensure high-quality, value-adding and digitally enabled audit execution.
• Contribute to regional or global Internal Audit methodology projects and continuous improvement initiatives.


Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Minimum requirements
What you’ll bring to the role
• Bachelor of Postgraduate degree preferably in business administration (accounting, finance, economics, marketing)
• Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in internal audit/advisory departments in a big four, in an IA boutique or consulting firm,
• OR 5 years of working experience in an internal audit department of an international company preferably in Pharma, medical devices, or Biotech sector
• OR a minimum of 7 years of experience in the business (e.g. commercial, general management, Finance) with a strong interest in internal audit
• Strong data analytics skills and good knowledge of SAP FI and CO modules, ACL, Tableau or other audit tools.
• Profound business acumen and knowledge of process management and/or business process optimization
• Team-player with excellent communication and project management skills, ability to collaborate effectively across a matrix
• Willingness to travel (up to 50%)

Why consider Novartis?
766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.
We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.
We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse team’s representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

title: Business Development Manager – International
company_info: Our forerunner, National Air Traffic Control Services (NATCS), was established in December 1962. It covered civil ATC but liaised with the Ministry of Defence (RAF) in areas where military traffic needed to cross civilian routes. When the Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) was established in April 1972, NATCS became part of it and shortened its name to NATS. We recognised that as a service provider, NATS should be operated at a distance from its regulator the CAA. With that in mind, NATS was re-organised into a Companies Act company in April 1996 and became a wholly owned subsidiary of the CAA. In June 1998, the Public-Private Partnership for NATS was proposed and enshrined in the Transport Act 2000. The Government chose the Airline Group (AG) as the preferred partner in March 2001 and the transaction was completed in July 2001 with the sale of 46% to the AG and the remaining 5% to staff. Although the Government retained the balance, the company was free of Treasury Control. The aviation industry downturn after 11 September 2001 led to a financial restructuring of NATS. This involved £130 million of additional investment (split between Government and Heathrow Airport Holdings Limited) to reduce borrowings. At the same time, Heathrow Airport Holdings Limited took a 4% shareholding, reducing the Airline Group’s holding to 42%. A £600 million bond issue, successfully completed in October 2003, further reduced our debt. In 2003, NATS launched its ten-year £1 billion investment programme with the announcement of a complete renewal of its radar network. Since then, we have worked with Nav Canada on a new system for Oceanic Control and became the first in Europe to establish a working Functional Airspace Block (FAB) with Irish counterparts. We also launched a Joint Venture company with the Spanish to develop the next generation of air traffic management systems for Europe.
job_category: General Management, Marketing / Public Relations, Professional Services, Telecommunications
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Profile
Role Title: Business Development Manager – International
Function: NATS Services Ltd (NSL)
Business: NATS International
Location: Singapore
Reports To: Head of Accounts and Partnerships – International

Role Purpose
To grow the NATS business (Order Intake, revenues, and EBIT) in designated accounts and countries. The role is responsible for NATS interests in this market, developing and implementing strategies, and to successfully build a sustainable business by establishing enduring/trusted relationships at all stakeholder levels.

Key Accountabilities
· Provide account management leadership in respect of international business accounts for NATS in priority countries, as directed and agreed with Head of Accounts and Partnerships – International.
· Develop and grow business across the designated countries and accounts to achieve associated targets.
· Develop and execute Country Plans and Account Development Plans for priority countries and accounts, including stakeholder maps and stakeholder engagement plans, and support NATS International strategy development.
· Generate opportunity weighted pipeline cover which is more than 150% of subsequent FY target for the allocated countries and accounts.
· Build and maintain key business relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
· Ensure NATS maintain a credible presence in each country or region to ensure that NATS Group capabilities are fully exploited.
· Own commercial propositions made to the customers within designated portfolio
· Oversee successful delivery of contracts and own all variation orders made to existing contracts within designated portfolio.
· In conjunction with the business development and business winning teams, identify and prioritise new business opportunities across priority countries.
· Lead the relevant Account Teams brought together from across the NATS functions to collaborate effectively and ensure successful preparation and submission of bids through to contract award.
· Ownership of accurate and timely business area performance reporting.

Qualifications, Skills and Personal Attributes
· Excellent knowledge of the aviation industry and ATM market.
· Proven business development and/or contract delivery experience in a large or complex, multi-function/multi-stakeholder, environment.
· Excellent leadership skills.
· Proven financial management experience.
· Able to lead the development of compelling business cases.
· Excellent influencing and negotiation skills.
· Comfortable in matrix management environments and with non-hierarchical structures.
· Able to assimilate and prioritise large volumes of complex financial and technical data, identify key issues and solutions.
· Able to engage and motivate teams in matrix structures to deliver high performance.
· Culturally aware and sensitive to different business practices, communication styles and customer expectations.
· Results driven, self-motivated to develop necessary capabilities for the role.
· Required to work flexibly across different time zones and working weeks.
· International travel as required.

title: Human Resources Recruitment Intern

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
As an Human Resources Recruitment Intern, you will be assisting the recruitment team in building our growing team of experts within the Capital Market industry.

WHO IS UPSKILLS?
Upskills supports banks and financial organizations to lead projects efficiently and reduce time to market. Our expertise in capital markets software, combined with strong functional knowledge and our commitment to excellence makes us quite unique in the industry.

Our service offerings cover the entire lifecycle of financial technology transformation projects be it a greenfield implementation, an extension, or an upgrade.

At Upskills, we are a team of creative thinkers and problem solvers, our ultimate mission is to breakthrough innovation! All of us are fully engaged in Fintech industry to deliver cutting-edge solutions for capital markets and digital transformation.

Our DNA is reflected in our values, these are how we act every day to make the greatest impact on what we are doing!

The Upskills 6
• We look for curious people, open-minded about ideas that challenge the status quo and ask why not!
• We all act proactively to learn and grow constantly.
• We foster an environment where all of us care for one another, promoting teamwork and collaboration.
• We strongly encourage respectful conversations that stimulate creativity and innovation.
• We all empower to think and act like owners, taking ownership of our work and driving impactful results.
• We are serious about fun, creating a positive and enjoyable workplace where individuals can thrive both personally and professionally.

Do our values speak to you?
If you see yourself enjoying working as a member of Upskills, then check out below!

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Conduct quality talent market research and proactive talent sourcing.
• Execute productive interviews (face-to-face, video conferences and phone) to qualify candidates and ensure a strong and thorough filtering process.
• Build and maintain network of potential candidates through effective candidate relationship management.
• Analyse and continuously improve the recruitment process in place.
• Work together with the team members on recruitment plans for junior financial systems consultants.
• Manage and organize the applicant tracking tool accordingly.

WHAT KIND OF INDIVIDUALS ARE WE SEEKING?
• Diploma or Degree Holder from relevant disciplines, preferably in Business Administration or Human Resources
• Previous experience in sourcing technical and financial profiles for regional and international roles is an advantage.
• Excellent communication and relationship management skills in English.
• Proactive with the ability to deliver tasks on-time and capable to think out of the box.
• Proven organisational skills and able to prioritize well to cope with competing demands. –
• Experienced with Microsoft Office applications, as well as Applicant Tracking and Career Sites. –
• Able to commit a minimum of 3 months.

OUR OFFER
Extensive learning opportunities: access to our upAcademy platform and learning sessions to develop your skills set throughout the year.
Fun in your daily life: Do you want to feel the vibe and the energy of Upskills, too? Enjoy team building activities, quarterly company events and plenty of engaging activities such as volunteering events, wellness challenges and festival celebrations!

A LITTLE BIT MORE ABOUT US…
We are located at Raffles place, the heart of financial hub in Singapore, surrounded by leading international businesses and financial institutions. Our welcoming space fosters collaboration and encourages lively discussions, providing a stimulating environment complemented by amenities such as kitchen facilities, refreshments, snacks, and an overall open working culture.

Join our team of passionate professionals by sending your resume to careers@upskills.com!

title: Head, Economic Promotion (International) / 3 years contract / Renewable
company_info: RMA Contracts is a professional Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) service provider that is dedicated to delivering a spectrum of innovative BPO services using cutting-edge technology for business success. As a one-stop integrated BPO partner, RMA Contracts is focus-driven on providing adept business solutions to streamline core business practices in today's challenging business environment in the areas of HR Consultancy, Recruitment and Manpower Outsourcing, Digitisation and Transaction Processing, Customer Relations and Managed Services.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title : Head, Economic Promotion (International)
Job Location : South Singapore
Job Type : Contract 3 years (Renewable)
Key Skills : International Business Development/ Investment Promotion/ Programme Management

Job Scope
Our client, an Investment and Development Entity between Singapore and China is looking out for suitable candidate to join as Head, Economic Promotion (International). This leadership role will be promoting the client into a leading low carbon, smart and vibrant economic hub through the following:
Develop strategic work plans and programmes to contribute towards investment promotion outcomes in low carbon, smart technology, biomedical, education, health, and tourism sectors
Engage Singapore and international enterprises to attract international investments and projects
Engage with industry partners and government agencies to foster joint collaborations and enhance the pro-business environment, government policies, and investment promotion initiatives
Promote value propositions and international branding internationally through industry outreach and media
Support the government’s investment promotion objectives, work plans and business events in Singapore
Research and report on international industry trends and developments that can be developed
Lead the Singapore Office day-to-day operations, including management reporting, financial planning, staff management and other administrative duties
Job Requirements
Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Real Estate, Finance, International Policy and any other relevant subject matter
At least 10 years of experience in international business development, project/programme management and/or investment promotion work
Strong leadership, strategic thinker, project execution, problem-solver and global team management experience
Familiar with Singapore industries, enterprises, business chambers, industry associations and the Singapore business eco-system
Prior work experience in the Singapore Government economic, national development and related organizations will be an advantage
Overseas work experience preferred, especially in the China market & be prepared to travel on business trips for short periods to become familiar with the business environment and facilitate bilateral investment promotion work.
Good command of both English and Chinese languages to liaise with government officials in China & business associates.
If this role is aligned with your experience and interest, please share your updated CV in word format at manisha.s@rmagroup.com.sg stating your current, expected salary and availability to take it forward. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

EA Regn No R1872602

title: Intern (Business Development and M&A Support)
company: SI PARTNERS SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About the job
Background
SI Partners is a global M&A advisory and consultancy to creative and digital technology businesses, helping stakeholders to build better businesses and realise equity value.
Working primarily in the marketing and communications, digital consulting, and related technology sectors, we operate across Europe, Asia and North America, from our London, Hong Kong, Shanghai and Singapore hubs.

Our commitment to the intern
Our objective is to recruit an energetic and dynamic intern to support the Managers, Directors and Partners directly in prospecting for potential clients in the APAC region. In exchange, we offer broad experience within an entrepreneurial and friendly work environment.
You will be allocated a direct line manager/mentor to support you throughout your time in the business, with responsibility for your development and ensuring your time with us is a mutual success.

Job Responsibilities
– Proactively researching potential clients for the business across Asia Pacific, within the digital consulting and marketing transformation sub-sectors
– Assisting with analysis of data research on companies in preparation for SI Partners’ marketing event, including:
taking such research to assist with identification of individual contact information (eg email addresses)
input to, and tidying up of existing data information on, CRM platform
– Supporting the client-facing team by assisting on tasks such as analysing companies’ strategic options, drafting of collaterals for transaction processes including teasers and business summaries, and supporting businesses through due diligence.
– Supporting the wider business through taking minutes, office support, assisting preparations for meetings and other tasks around the office.

Requirements
The successful candidate should be a confident individual, with demonstrable financial and analytical skills. They must be able to communicate clearly, with strong written and presentational skills, and be personable, with the ability to create a rapport within the team and with prospective clients.The successful candidate will also need to have good computer and typing skills.

This is a varied role, where the work we entrust you with can differ from day-to-day, so we are looking for someone who is a great ‘all-rounder’. The candidate will need to have a 'can-do' attitude and ability to use their initiative. Good teamwork skills are essential.

You will be studying for, or recently completed, a university degree. A Business/Accounting based course is preferred but not essential.

You will have a high standard of written and spoken English. The successful candidate will be available to work full time across September - December of 2023 (flexible on the start and end date). Part time applicants will not be considered.

If you are interested, please send the resume to adminsg@sipartnersglobal.com

company_info: Christian Dior Couture offers more than a beautiful brand to the world and clients. Strong analytical, strategic thinking / planning and problem-solving skills
Experienced in improvement projects, effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Diligent, customer oriented, attention to details, willing to learn and develop
Good team player, positive thinking, “can do” attitude
Proficient in Microsoft Office software

title: R0257630 - CAO– AFC Singapore AML Officer (International Private Bank) – AVP
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team:
Deutsche Bank benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society. Our regional/global matrix structure allows for flexible responses to challenges in the core areas of: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment.
Our AFC Team will provide you with opportunities to learn, grow and define your career. We foster an open, diverse, and inclusive team culture, that is engaged and well-supported for prosperity and enjoyment of a life/work balance.
The Singapore Anti-Money Laundering Department, part of Anti Financial Crime, supports Deutsche Bank businesses in Singapore in managing AML risk, is responsible for ensuring related processes are in place and that all policies, procedures and guidelines conform to internal DB policies and MAS regulations. The operations in Singapore include a Branch and capital markets services licensees.
For candidates with the relevant seniority or experience, additional regional responsibilities will be conferred.
What we will offer you:
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce is better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities:
The AML Officer’s responsibilities include working within the existing AML team to:
Assist in the continued implementation of the applicable Group and divisional Policies on AML and KYC, through working closely with Client Onboarding colleagues and carrying out quarterly AML controls over relationships in Wealth Management Division.
Decide on new or existing Singapore relationships that are escalated by the local onboarding staff or deciding to escalate further.
Assist in the maintenance of the Singapore or entity-level AML policies, procedures and AML Compliance program, as well as the annual Risk Analysis and the coordination of updates to Regional/Global AML.
Assist in validation of the AML Monitoring parameters and Transaction Screening databases and being the approval point for client third party payments.
Assist in the review of New Product Approval requests and smart sourcing initiatives for Singapore where appropriate.
Assist in the fulfillment of local regulatory information requests from MAS and CAD, or within regulatory inspections.
Assist in the Suspicious Transaction Reporting process to investigate AML Transaction Monitoring and other alerts including hits against the payment filter and ensure suspicious transactions in Singapore are reported to the authorities and appropriately logged.
Providing or assisting the provision of training on local regulatory requirements and internal policies, along with producing training materials.
Your skills and experience:
6+ years’ experience AML practitioner with holistic AML / Financial Crime knowledge and skills
Minimum 6 years of relevant experience/exposure in private banking/high networth segments
Prior related experience in fronting stakeholders for discussions
Work experience in a regulator or financial institution
Degree qualified
Relevant AML or related certifications (CAMS, CFE, IntDipAML)
Understanding one or more of the business areas of investment banking, corporate banking, trade finance, asset management and/or private bank, and risk profile of each category.
Strong analytical skills
Strong interpersonal and influencing skills
Customer service orientation
Attention to detail
Performance orientation
Teamwork
Good stakeholder management good communication skills
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks under pressure
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirement applies.
How we’ll support you:
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams:
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. click here to see what we do
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) Intern
company_info: SATS is the leading provider of gateway services and food solutions in the region. An evolution that has been the result of our commitment to delight customers and enable their success. SATS caters to the needs of the aviation sector and a host of other businesses in hospitality, food, healthcare, freight and logistics industries besides governments. Our passion to bring the best to every individual customer is what has catalysed the expansion of our business lines, to include the finest of food offerings as well as an extended set of services that brings them the benefit of our speed, quality and absolute reliability. With an experience spanning over 60 years and a growing regional presence, SATS is poised for a new phase of growth, creating value for our customers, partners and shareholders, in Singapore and beyond. Gateway Services SATS’ gateway services encompass ramp and baggage handling, airfreight handling and logistics, passenger services and lounge management, aviation security as well as cruise handling and terminal management. Food Solutions SATS’ food solutions business comprises airline catering, food distribution and logistics, institutional and remote-site catering, chilled, ambient and frozen food manufacturing as well as linen and laundry services. Visit http://www.sats.com.sg/Media/LatestNews/Pages/LatestNews.aspx for more information on our latest news and events.

title: Creative Interns
company_info: PlayPark PTE. LTD. Asiasoft publishes MMOPG (Massively Multiplayer Online Playing Game) in South East Asia. Be a part of this vibrant and exciting industry. Candidates who are young-at-heart, adventurous and think out of the box are invited to join us in the following position(s).
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Title: Creative Designer Intern

About the Role:

Are you a master of visual sorcery and a creative genius? Join our dynamic marketing team as a Creative Intern!

Responsibilities:

Unleash your creative powers to design visually stunning marketing materials, including digital assets, social media visuals, website graphics, and promotional content.

Collaborate closely with the marketing team to bring campaigns to life through captivating and on-brand designs that resonate with our target audience

Transform concepts and ideas into captivating visual stories that engage and inspire players.

Apply your artistic expertise to create eye-catching illustrations, logos, and icons that will be etched into the minds of our audience.

Assist in creating pixel-perfect designs for websites, mobile apps, and other digital platforms, ensuring a seamless and immersive user experience.

Stay up-to-date with design trends and industry best practices, continually pushing the boundaries of creativity to set our brand apart.

Adapt designs to fit different marketing channels and platforms while maintaining brand consistency.

Communicate design concepts and ideas effectively to stakeholders, ensuring alignment and understanding.

Collaborate with external vendors, printers, and production teams to ensure high-quality execution of design deliverables.

Requirements:

Mastery of design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.) – your trusted arsenal!
Proven experience in creating visually stunning designs and a captivating portfolio showcasing your talents.
Knowledge of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout techniques – your secret spellbook!
Proficiency in English is essential for effective communication within the team.
Fluency in Mandarin is an advantage, to liaise with Chinese-speaking counterparts.
Passion for the gaming industry and understanding of popular games and trends.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring every pixel is in perfect harmony.
Ability to adapt to evolving project requirements and provide creative solutions.

title: Marketing Intern
company_info: IFS Capital Limited (“IFS”) was incorporated in Singapore in 1987 and has been listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange since July 1993. It has regional offices in Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and Indonesia. As a regional Group, it provides commercial finance services like factoring, hire-purchase/leasing, loans, government-assisted schemes and trade/export finance to small and medium enterprises (“SMEs”). The Group also provides bonds and guarantees, credit insurance and general insurance through its wholly owned subsidiary, ECICS Limited. IFS Capital Group is part of the PhillipCapital network of companies, an integrated Asian financial house with a global presence that provides a full range of solutions covering individuals, family offices, and corporate and institutional clients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a creative and motivated Marketing Intern to join our Product Team in IFS Capital Singapore and the candidate will report to the Head of Product. This internship is an excellent opportunity for individuals who are looking to gain practical skills into the dynamic field of marketing.

Responsibilities:
- Gathering data, conducting competitor analysis, and identifying trends and insights to support marketing strategies
- Monitor and track marketing campaign results and provide recommendations for improvement
- Contribute to the development of product positioning, messaging, and marketing collateral.
- Develop and create content for various marketing channels – website, blog posts, social media, EDMs and marketing materials
- Assist to manage and maintain the company’s social medial accounts, monitor engagement and analysing social media metrics
- Assist in coordination of marketing events, including trade shows, conferences, and workshop
- Stay updated on industry news, market best practices and emerging trends to contribute fresh ideas and insights

Requirements:
- Must be able to commit for 6 months
- Pursuing a Diploma or University degree in either Marketing, Communications, Business or any related discipline
- Creative mindset with a keen eye for content creation
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills
- Positive attitude and willingness to learn
- Prior marketing internship or co-curricular experience is preferred

title: Marketing Intern
company_info: Established in 2018 and part of HMI Group, StarMed Specialist Centre is a one-stop private ambulatory care centre, comprising of GP and health screening services, specialist clinics, operating theatres, endoscopy suites, radiology facilities, physiotherapy centre, day suites and occupational health services. Our core specialties include Cardiology, Colorectal, Digestive & Liver, Ear, Nose &Throat, Gastroenterology & Hepatology, Gastrointestinal & Vascular, General Practice, Gynaecology, Internal Medicine, Orthopaedics, Ophthalmology, Paediatrics, Respiratory & Critical Care and Weight Management.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
StarMed is a one-stop day-surgery and multi-disciplinary medical centre that offers quality day procedure n diagnostic services at competitive private sector prices. As a marketing intern, you will be given the opportunity to be part of the marketing team and contribute to the marketing and growth of StarMed Specialist Centre. This role offers exposure to a range of marketing activities, both digital and traditional, while proving hands-on experience in the healthcare industry.
Within the marketing team, you will also be playing a crucial role in supporting the growth of the relevant business units including corporate sales, concierge services and partnership & engagement.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Participate in the planning and execution of strategic marketing and communication activities for both digital and traditional channels (e.g Out-of-home, print collaterals, social media, website, EDM).
Collaborate with the design team to brief them on necessary requirements for marketing creatives.
Craft content for digital, print and outdoor marketing channels through effective copywriting and ideation. Experience in designing and video editing is a plus.
Manage stakeholders through timely submission of deliverables, regular communications and updates.
Request for proposals/quotations for marketing campaigns & partnership engagements.
Collaborate with clinic staff and doctors for successful end-to-end execution of marketing/customer service enhancement campaigns.
Offer support at marketing events, when required.
Assist with other ad-hoc duties as assigned
Requirements:
Able to commence immediately and commit for at least 4-6 months
Enjoy communicating with people and is always eager to learn new things
Good interpersonal skills, a good team player, and has good time management skills

title: Research Intern (SPACE)
company_info: As the first CNRS subsidiary abroad, CNRS@CREATE has been working since mid-2019 with Singapore's universities and research institutes, as well as with the international partners of the CREATE campus, to develop projects in areas related to social and economic challenges of Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description: Research Intern
About Us:
The SPACE project is developing a research protocol for infectious disease prediction and prevention in Singapore. The project draws upon analyses of the risk factors and sociospatial patterns that drive dengue and COVID-19 transmission in Singapore, as well as the social and technical skills developed by individuals and community groups in response to disease propagation. Combining insight from the social sciences (geography, architecture and urban design, communication, economics, sociology, public policy) with biology (epidemiology, entomology) and computer science (artificial intelligence, biostatistics), the project will use the concept of “adaptive capacity” (AC) to explore the potential of community-based “latent social capital” (i.e. human, cultural, political, and social) as key assets for adaptive responses to health challenges related to dengue in its interplay with COVID-19.
The project brings together 23 researchers, 10 from France and 13 from five Singaporean universities (NTU, NUS, SUTD, SMU and SUSS). The research will be conducted in several residential areas of Singapore. The fellow will receive a competitive salary and generous funding to support his/her research.
Job Description:
CNRS @ CREATE is looking for a research intern to join our team for a period of 3 months. On a general level, applicants will be selected through a careful assessment of their qualification suitability, synergy and alignment with the work package “Built and social environment of residential neighborhoods”. In this role, you will get a chance to:
· Recruit research participants and scheduling of interviews;
· Conduct qualitative interviews with seniors and staff in the healthcare sector, and contribute ethnographic observations on your experiences (training will be provided); and
· Clean, transcribe, and analyse qualitative data.
This is an ideal opportunity for those interested in developing their career in the fields of qualitative research, healthcare, infectious disease and prevention.
Required:
· Interest in working with residential neighbourhoods;
· Some experience in conducting interviews and/or ethnographic research;
· Proficiency in two Singapore’s official languages would be preferred; a bonus would be fluency in dialects such as Hokkien/Teochew/Cantonese.
Preferred:
· Experience in working with residential neighbourhoods;
· Knowledge of qualitative research methods;
· Experience with data cleaning and with analytical software such NVivo or similar.
The research intern will be remunerated around S$1,000, depending on experience. We would ideally like you to work with us from October 2023 onwards. We look forward to working with you on this exciting and dynamic project.
Please submit your CV and a brief cover letter to Raksha Mahtani at raksha.mahtani@cnrsatcreate.sg.

Aside from excelling in our core business, we are a people-centric company which cares deeply about the well-being and growth of our personnel. employment_type: Contract, Flexi-work, Freelance, Full Time, Internship/Attachment, Part Time, Permanent, Temporary
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Education and Training, Human Resources, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Find Out Even More At: https://tinyurl.com/mindflex-intern
Hi! Our company is looking for Polytechnic/University Interns who are able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 Months & Above (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships that are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our play seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a cosy office environment with modern facilities such as a PS5, pool table, karaoke system & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly no over-time culture, no bring-work-home culture
Learning Scope:
Complete experience of sales & operations process (initial touch-base with clients, order preparation, invoicing, after-sales service)
Enjoy first-hand & real-world experience with actual customer communication, unique problem solving & critical thinking
Exposure to real-life and practical marketing tools such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Carousell Ads, SEO (Ahrefs, SEMRush)
Learn & experience how to use customised back-end software which have been specially designed & tailored to fulfill the company's business needs & improve efficiency
Be involved in company's business development through assigned projects with fellow interns
Be exposed to application & conceptualisation of business strategies from the perspective of market leaders in the tuition industry
Job scope will be a 70-30% split between Operations & Marketing tasks
Responsibilities:
Be actively involved with Business & Marketing Operations of an Educational Agency on a day-to-day basis
Communicate well with new clients (warm leads), engaging them & helping them to understand better their tuition needs
Prepare client's requirements & present them in an attractive yet concise job-post format for tutors to apply in
Be in charge of filtering & broadcasting available tuition assignments via the company's various outreach channels (WhatsApp, Telegram, Email & many more)
Assist in actively profiling tutors and marketing them in a way which captures the consumer's attention based on their required needs
Assist in sales-closing & after-sales process. Work cohesively with other team members to solve unique day-to-day problems
Assist in Digital Marketing Tasks such as creating engaging Facebook & Instagram Posts
Actively involved in active link-building and outreach campaigns to improve company's internet presence
Assist with content creation on company's website through web building tools such as WordPress
Job Requirements:
Current Polytechnic/University Student, Singaporean
Good Command of Both Written & Verbal English
Friendly, Passionate and Energetic Team Player
Organized and Good Administrative Skills
Responsible and Strong Work Ethic
Decent Typing Speed and Computer Skills
Polite, Patient and Calm Personality
Location & Working Hours:
Location: Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Near Bishan/Marymount MRT)
4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend, 9.00am - 6.30pm
(Working days of your choosing & mutually agreed with the company)
Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture
Internship Allowance:
$800/Month (Polytechnic)
$1,000/Month (University)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Company Culture and Working Environment
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Office with Modern Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep
Application:
Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Internship Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:
1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Winter Teaching Intern (Nov / Dec 2023 - Jan 2024)
company: THE LEARNINGLAB EDUCATION CENTRE PTE LTD
company_info: Headquartered in Singapore, The Learning Lab (“TLL”) is a leading education platform in Southeast Asia, and the #1 market leader in Singapore’s premium tuition and enrichment sector. TLL’s year-round, after-school programmes are underpinned by a proprietary and research-backed curriculum, as well as best-in-class teacher training and recruitment, both designed to stimulate students’ natural curiosity, self-aware participation and critical thinking. Having been chiefly an offline provider for most of the 20 years since its founding, TLL has, in recent years, successfully enhanced its online capabilities, which now support hybrid learning and already offer a scalable and digitally-delivered product to ASEAN markets and expatriates. This in turn lays the foundation for TLL’s other EdTech initiatives with high growth potential.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Teaching Intern (English / Math / Science)
Why Teach with Us?
The Learning Lab’s teaching internship gives top students the chance to gain an insight into the education sector and the corporate world. It provides an opportunity for individuals to gain valuable experience in the education industry while pursuing their studies.
Who we look for
You are an intensely passionate educator who loves nurturing kids – not just the brightest but also the shy underdog. You will happily go out of your way to bring the best to your students and bring out the best in them.
In this role, you will
Receive training on how to plan and deliver effective lessons
Teach cover classes
Prepare and deliver lessons, mark scripts in accordance with TLL’s teaching and curriculum standards to ensure a high quality of student learning.
Create and maintain a safe and conducive learning environment for students
Establish and maintain good relationships with students and parents
Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned
Snapshots of our ideal candidate
University undergraduates or A-Levels / IB / Diploma graduates with an excellent academic track record
Able to work 3 weekdays and both weekends (Saturday and Sunday), and commit from mid November 2023/start of December to the first week of January 2024
Willing to travel between the various TLL centres for classes, as and when required
Personable and possesses a natural affinity with children
Passion for teaching and nurturing young minds
Adaptable, resilient and likes challenges
Excellent interpersonal communication skills and classroom management skills
Expect the best for the best
An attractive remuneration package
In-house training
Company-wide welfare and employee engagement initiatives
Are you ready to join us and groom the future leaders of tomorrow?
Start your journey with us today at www.thelearninglab.com.sg/joinus/. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 weeks from the date of application.

title: photographer - intern
company: THE CLOVER BRIDAL HOUSE PTE. LTD.
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company: Clover photo is an established photography studio in Singapore specializing in wedding, family portriats and professional photography.

Job Description
The incumbent will assist the senior photographers and are responsible for capturing the big day for weddings and sytlised shoots for family, baby and professional shots.
They work closely with the clients to ensure that every important moment is preserved in photographs.

Photographers must be able to anticipate what will happen next so they can be ready to take the perfect shot at just the right time. They also need to have a good eye for composition and design—they’re not just snapping pictures of people standing around awkwardly; they’re creating art that captures the emotions of this special day.

Job Duties
Photographers have a wide range of responsibilities, which can include:
Managing client relationships and working with them to create a vision that will be captured in images and videos
Shooting pictures of the bride getting ready for the event, including details such as the bride’s hair, makeup, and accessories
Editing photos using software programs and providing prints of the edited photos for clients
Shooting photos of the bride and groom at the wedding ceremony and reception
Shooting candid photos of guests during the reception or other events leading up to the wedding
Creating a shot list of which photos need to be taken at each event or location during the wedding day

title: Intern - Computing
company_info: Ventas Bio Pte Ltd is a medical device manufacturing company with a robust commitment to innovation, quality, and patient safety. While we maintain a global reach, we are proud of our roots in Singapore's biomedical hub At Ventas Bio, we align ourselves with the rhythms of biology, understanding that each innovation we create is part of a broader ecosystem of health and wellbeing. Our devices are designed to provide reliable and effective solutions while minimizing intrusion. Ventas Bio is more than a medical device manufacturer. We are a dedicated team of innovators and pioneers working together to improve the future of healthcare, one device at a time. Our mission is not merely to create, but to care, to innovate, and to inspire. In our hands, we hold not just technology, but hope for a healthier, better tomorrow.
address: JTC MEDTECH HUB, 2 TUKANG INNOVATION GROVE 618305
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Ventas Bio Pte Ltd, an innovator in the medical device manufacturing industry, is thrilled to announce an exciting opportunity for tech-savvy and creative individuals interested in driving digital transformation within our dynamic organisation. This position is open to everyone, including individuals seeking an internship or short-term employment for a duration of two to three months.

Key Responsibilities:
Spearhead the reorganisation and modernisation of our Electronic Document Management System, ensuring that critical business information is easily accessible and its integrity is preserved.
Apply your coding skills to automate repetitive administrative tasks, enabling our teams to focus more on strategic activities and innovation.
Build engaging training materials using a variety of content formats, including video, photography, and interactive elements.
Transform our e-learning platform into a dynamic and interactive knowledge-sharing hub, creating an efficient and engaging training experience for our team.
Collaborate with various teams to understand their technological needs and design effective digital solutions.
Gain a thorough understanding of the medical device manufacturing industry and apply this knowledge to enhance operational efficiency and product quality.
Leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning tools to streamline operations and improve quality.
Ideal Candidate:
A tech-savvy individual with coding skills and a strong interest in emerging digital trends.
A motivated self-starter with excellent problem-solving skills, strong communication abilities, and a collaborative mindset.
Joining our team will provide a unique opportunity to gain comprehensive knowledge in Regulatory Affairs (RA), Quality Assurance (QA), and Quality Management Systems (QMS) in the medical device industry.

At Ventas Bio, we are passionate about fostering talent, promoting innovation, and creating meaningful impacts on healthcare. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to contribute significantly to digital transformation in the medical device manufacturing industry.

Ventas Bio is an equal-opportunit employer. We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

If you're ready to test your creativity and technical skills in a rewarding environment, apply today!

title: Client Executive / Relationship Manager to Private Wealth Management & Family Office International, Singapore
company_info: SEB is the leading corporate and investment bank in the Nordic countries, serving large corporations, financial institutions, banks and commercial real estate clients with corporate banking, trading and markets and global transaction services. SEB was founded in 1856 and is present in 20 countries worldwide with approximately 16,000 employees. The position will be located in SEB Singapore where the office was established in 1979. SEB Singapore has more than 100 professionals.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group. Bring an entrepreneurial mindset, passion for learning, and a collaborative nature, and you will have the opportunity for a long and exciting career here. We’re searching for a talented Client Executive/Relationship Manager in Private Wealth Management & Family Office International in Singapore.

At SEB, we have always believed that the future depends on turning great ideas into reality. Ever since we welcomed our first customer in 1856, we have been a catalyst for positive change by providing responsible advice and capital to people with ideas for the future. Grounded in our long history and strong heritage, we want to create long-term value for all our stakeholders by being curious about what the future holds. We have a strong ambition to accelerate the pace towards a sustainable future for people, businesses, and society. Our skilled and dedicated employees stand by our customers in good times and bad and offer financial products and services that meet their ever-changing needs – both in our home markets in northern Europe and through our international network around the world.

Read more: https://sebgroup.com/

Who we are looking for:
Client Executive/Relationship Manager to Private Wealth Management & Family Office International, Singapore

To further develop and enhance our position as the Asian center of competence for Private Wealth Management and Professional Family Office clients within SEB Group, we are looking to recruit a Client Executive/Relationship Manager to join our team in Singapore.

You will be part of an international, and customer-oriented team supporting a divisional business and SEB’s Strategic ambition, as the only Nordic bank with a Private Wealth Management & Family Office presence in Asia. We are a dedicated team consisting of experienced Client Executives and Account Managers working closely with wealthy Nordic and German families residing or investing in Asia.

We are part of SEB AB Singapore Branch that serves as the hub for Private Wealth Management services to Nordic and German nationals living in Asia. The Singapore Branch also offers services to Nordic & German corporates with a presence in Asia within Corporate banking, Financial Institutions & Shipping. SEB AB Singapore branch has 100 employees with 11 different nationalities.

SEB Private Wealth Management & Family Office division has the responsibility to provide a full range of dedicated services such as investment management, wealth planning, financing & mortgage solutions in addition to everyday banking for wealthy private individuals, investment companies and professional family offices. We have offices in the Nordic countries, as well as in Luxembourg, United Kingdom, France, Germany & Singapore.
We are seeking an experienced business-driven talent to join us as Client Executive/Relationship Manager to support the Private Wealth Management & Family Office International in Singapore.

The role will be based in Singapore and reports to the Head of Private Wealth Management & Family Office International in Singapore.

Requirements
You possess strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize between different deliveries to meet deadlines.
Due to the portfolio, you must have excellent verbal and written English language skills, in addition to fluency in one of the Nordic languages.
Excellent relationship skills, and your client-focused mindset is reflected in your proactive way of working. You always put client satisfaction first and have a pragmatic approach towards the client.
You are a natural team player, which allows you to collaborate efficiently across departments and geographies. You are flexible and you adapt quickly to new and unexpected situations and use them as an opportunity for learning.
Experience from international and Nordic Private Wealth Management environment and clients is a prerequisite.
Responsibilities
Full client relationship and account administration including but not limiting to:
Investment advisory and trade execution
Multi-currency account management and cross border payments
Coordination of client offering cross division and cross border
Ensure accounts comply with regulatory requirements including KYC and AML
Only short-listed applicants will be notified.

title: Data Engineer Intern
company_info: IFS Capital Limited (“IFS”) was incorporated in Singapore in 1987 and has been listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange since July 1993. It has regional offices in Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia and Indonesia. As a regional Group, it provides commercial finance services like factoring, hire-purchase/leasing, loans, government-assisted schemes and trade/export finance to small and medium enterprises (“SMEs”). The Group also provides bonds and guarantees, credit insurance and general insurance through its wholly owned subsidiary, ECICS Limited. IFS Capital Group is part of the PhillipCapital network of companies, an integrated Asian financial house with a global presence that provides a full range of solutions covering individuals, family offices, and corporate and institutional clients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are searching for a dedicated Data Engineer talent to join our Data Team at IFS Capital in Singapore. This internship offers an excellent opportunity for individuals with a strong passion for data and eager to gain hands-on experience to expand project exposure, especially in the field of data pipeline infrastructure and management.

Responsibilities:
· Build data schemas, mappings, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows.
· Develop and maintain data ingestion pipelines, perform API integration.
· Implement automation data flows.
· Clean, preprocess, and transform raw data to ensure consistency, quality, and usability.
· Optimize data storage for cost-effectiveness and performance.
· Implement data quality checks and validation to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
· Govern data backup & recovery, data encryption and data integrity.

Requirements:
· Must be able to commit for 6 -12 months.
· Students pursuing Diploma / Degree/ Fresh graduate in computer science, data science, software engineering, information technology, mathematics, physics, or any related discipline.
· Strong problem-solving & analytical skills, critical thinking and resourceful.
· Positive attitude and willingness to learn.
· Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
· Proficient in SQL and Python
· Good knowledge of Database or Data warehouse
· Good knowledge of Cloud Computing i.e AWS, Azure, Google Cloud is a plus
· Good knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery and Version Control i.e Git is a plus

Smart+, our proprietary robotic work management system, enables robots to communicate with each other, with building infrastructure and building management system. We have the largest commercial deployments of inspection and security robots in Singapore and are expanding to overseas markets such as Australia and Hong Kong. Our customers are predominantly in the commercial security, facility management, logistics warehouses and hospitality sectors.

title: MS Office 365 / Microsoft SharePoint, Internal Optimization Specialist / Graduated from Local Uni / West Tuas /
company_info: At Search Index, we believe in working along closely with our clients in an enduring partnership towards successful career placement. We specialise in identifying and assessing candidates and recruiting them from junior to senior level roles across all industry sectors. We provides end-to-end solutions ranging from Permanent, Contract, Temporary and Project based placement. Executive Search Payroll and Staff Management Search Index is committed in providing the highest level of service with our extensive knowledge of human resources, consultancy and search expertise. We work with Local Small Medium Enterprise (SMEs) and Multinational Companies (MNCs) across various industries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Broad Function

The Internal Optimization Specialist plays a critical role in enhancing the efficiency, collaboration, and overall effectiveness of our organization by leveraging the capabilities of the MS Office 365 suite. We require a self-starter, an individual who has the drive and passion to be involved in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing solutions using MS Office 365 tools to streamline workflows, enhance communication, and drive productivity.

Key Responsibilities:

Process Analysis and Improvement
Collaborate with various departments to understand existing processes and workflows.
Analyze business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
Identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and areas for improvement within these processes.
Propose, design, develop and implement software automation solutions to streamline and optimize processes.
Office 365 Implementation

Utilize Office 365 tools such as SharePoint, Teams, Power Automate, and MS Flow / PowerApps to create solutions that align with business needs.
Configure SharePoint sites and document libraries for efficient document management, version control, and collaboration.
Set up Teams channels, chatbots, and integrations to enhance communication and collaboration across teams.
Develop custom MS Flow / Power Automate flows and PowerApps to automate repetitive tasks and create user-friendly applications.
Experience in setting up Multi-Approval workflows with MS Flow / Power Automate
• Develop and maintain project documentation, including requirements, functional specifications, and user manuals
Official Microsoft Certification is preferred • RPA experience (UIPath etc) would be idea
Training and Support:
Provide training and guidance to employees on effectively using Office 365 tools to improve their workflow.
Address user’s questions, troubleshoot issues, and provide technical support for software solutions
Data Analysis and Reporting

Collect and analyze data related to the usage and effectiveness of implemented Office 365 solutions.
Create reports, dashboards and visualisations to effectively communicate data-driven insights to various stakeholders.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in an accurate and concise manner and continuously refine reporting processes to improve accuracy, efficiency and effectiveness of data.
Security and Compliance
Ensure that all implemented solutions adhere to security and compliance standards.
Collaborate with IT and security teams to implement necessary controls and safeguards
Continuous Improvement
Stay updated on the latest features and updates within the Office 365 suite.
Proactively identify opportunities for ongoing optimizations and enhancements based on changing business needs.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field with Local University
Proven 2-3 years of working experience in data analytics and also with Office 365 suite, including SharePoint, Teams, Power Automate, and PowerApps.
Strong understanding of business processes and workflow optimization.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and deliver training.
Attention to detail and commitment to maintaining data integrity and security.
Relevant certifications such as Microsoft 365 Certified: Fundamentals or Microsoft 365 Certified: Modern Desktop Administrator Associate are advantageous.
Other Information

5 days work week
Work location in TUAS
Transport provided at Boon Lay MRT
Salary between $5,000 - $6,500
Interested candidates kindly send in your resume to search69@searchindex.com.sg

we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

title: R0280921 - International Private Bank Agile - Client Journey Product Owner Domain Lead and Digital Channels Lead Product Owner - Director
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team
Deutsche Bank’s Private Banking business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer affluent clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Private Banking.
As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations. We create lasting value for clients. We develop bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate & Investment Bank and Deutsche Asset Management. We combine financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships.
What we will offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities
Product Owner Domain Lead and Lead Product Owner Responsibilities
The Emerging Markets Product Owner Domain Lead (PODL) for Client Journey is responsible in defining and realising the purpose for the respective group of squads in line with the Tribe Domain and Region.
In the PODL capacity in Client Journey, you are responsible to set the agenda and act as an oversight lead for the Emerging Markets squads covering our clients in APAC, Latam and MEA, in both Digital Channels (focused on e-banking platform) and Sales Enablement (focused on core CRM system to service Relationship Managers).
You will be reporting into global Tribe Domain Lead Global Channel and Process and work in partnership with Tribe Lead Digital Channel and Regional Change Lead whilst working closely with business and RMs to drive digital client experience.
The APAC Lead Product Owner (PO) for Digital Channels within Client Journey is responsible for APAC (SG and HK) Digital Channels across Deutsche Wealth Online “DWO”, the core e-banking platform offered to clients. You will work closely with the POs for DWO in APAC and the other booking centers
The Lead Product Owner is accountable for maximising the value of features delivered with his/her multidisciplinary Agile team. The features may be purely IT-technical, non-technical or a combination addressing end-to-end requirements including related processes, initiative roll-out and adoption.
The Lead Product Owner is the person with ultimate accountability for designing, building and running digital journeys and its related end-to-end processes that are wide ranging in nature, best-in-class, simple, easy-to-use, and benefit Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management Emerging Markets digital clients.
As a Lead Product Owner, you are managing together with the other POs the interface to internal and external customers, users and stakeholders, being accountable for the product vision, delivery roadmap, product backlog and the realisation of the agreed product outcomes, meeting relevant quality parameters.
In this combined dual PODL and Lead PO role, it is critical to align scope and priorities to relevant strategic and business goals with clear requirements for customers, users and management/stakeholders alike.
As a servant-leader, you enable your Agile team to work in a self-directed way with team members supported in applying their skills to innovate and deliver the agreed product outcomes.
You are a constant source of guidance and review feedback for their Agile team and stakeholders, you also sign-off work products completed by the Agile team.
Key Responsibilities
In your PODL capacity, you will serve as a key stakeholder with senior management and helping define and drive to delivery initiatives for both Emerging Markets Digital Channels and Sales Enablement.
Responsible for the regional alignment of deliveries for the Tribe Domain across tribes.
Align with regional Product Owners and Global Tribe lead for creating and continuously iterating on a multi-year product roadmap and creating the business requirements.
Help set Regional Priorities / OKRs and Milestones in line with global vision.
Drive People and Talent Management for your region; define Total Performance Indicators (TPIs) for POs and resolve escalations in regions.
Work to support influencing priorities in a global and regional context
In your Lead PO capacity, translate strategic and business requirements and pipeline into a clear implementable digital change roadmap.
Oversee, drive and manage the end-to-end delivery of Client Journey digital change, partnering with various other Agile tribes, and Run the Bank Subject Matter Experts including Business, COO, Divisional Control Office, Operations, Legal and Compliance.
Leveraging Digital technical insights, market trends and customer research to design seamless customer journeys, increasing conversations and transactions.
Work closely with the end-users / internal clients to plan and prioritize in line with expectation and needs.
Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value.
Ensure deliveries are high quality, on time and in line with Agile QBR timelines and business needs.
Lead other POs and squad members to develop state-of the art digital solutions.
Act as a leader, instilling confidence to the overall squad and being front-runner and example for the whole team.
Aligning with Scrum Master to communicate progress of the Agile delivery team including status reporting.
Liaising with business and control functions stakeholders to create a go-to-market strategy and on-going adoption strategy to increase usage of digital channels by clients in line with regulatory requirements.
Expected to play an end-to-end delivery role with the ability to closely liaise with the technical implementation team.
Key overall day-to-day tasks include:
- Prepare and provide transparent clear updates on initiatives to various stakeholder both within and outside Agile organisation.
- Development of professional working relationships with various stakeholder groups (Business, Control Functions, External Vendors) across all seniority levels and regions.
- Scope the system / digital solutions / business process: Work closely together with the Journey Experts and Business Analysts and other squad members, to ensure right granularity of requirements specification on an epic / story level.
- Support client acquisition and digital solutions adoption activities based on structured data analysis and KPIs tracking.
- Translate business needs: Create models, diagrams, presentations and other documentations that support the target audience to understand the business requirements.
- Facilitate communication at team level in order to create consensus on scope, design decisions, and implementation decisions.
- Validate E2E requirements, UAT Testing, Sprint Demos etc (if required).
- Proactively Identify risks / issues that might affect squad’s overall health.
Your skills and experience
Digital native, with 15 years’ experience in Digital product management in financial services, investment, wealth management and/or private banking domains, with at least 8years spent as a Product or Channel Owner.
Experience with digital e-banking platforms or similar digital client offerings and have experience rolling out applications in the Client Channel domain.
Strong Agile team leadership experience and technology delivery, and understanding of digital channels technologies with ability to lead a multi-functional team comprising of business and technical resources.
Experience with CRM systems and nice to have experience with Avaloq core banking system.
Individuals must have client experience design, following Design Thinking, Human Centered Design and similar methodologies.
Strong domain experience in Wealth management and/or Private Banking to be able to address customer pain points and drive innovative solutions.
Experience leading large cross functional teams and ability to manage / influence outside direct line of responsibilities.
Awareness and understanding about digital developments and customer expectations from digital banking products and services.
Strong understanding of customer experience design and user experience principles
Understanding the Agile delivery principles and strong knowledge about scrum & Agile lean delivery being an official Certified product owner.
Excellent communications and stakeholder management.
Expertise in conceptual modelling; ability to see the big picture and envision possible solutions.
Relevant and demonstrable experience in designing and documenting requirements in Agile teams on digital transformation.
Clear ability to provide concise, precise and analytical answers to a wide array of Digital / CRM / Business related topics.
Knowledge of Agile methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban, ...) and tools (Jira or Confluence).
Understanding of latest client channel technology stacks and technology architecture standards.
Experience in working in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
Ability to deal with complex and ambiguous situations independently and with limited guidance.
Independent and proactive working method and a high-quality standard.
Flexibility for moving between different requirements on a timely manner.
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.
How we’ll support you
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Part Time, Intern or Full Time Escape Room Game Operations
company_info: No information added.
job_category: Customer Service, Entertainment, Events / Promotions, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Looking for a different kind of part time or full time service role that's actually FUN?

And with a pretty cool job title: Game Master!

We are currently hiring part-time and full time staff who are excited about escape rooms (and horror / thriller themes in general). You'll be working in a tightly knit fun team to provide the following to our wonderful customers:

- Greet customers and assist them with bookings on site and via phone calls
- Conduct an engaging briefing of game rules and back story of the games customers are playing
- Assist customers with hints during the game and prompting them with clues for them to progress to the next stage
- Cashiering duties
- Staging the games by resetting after each game and sanitising the common touch points
- To provide immaculate service while watching the games to ensure customers are safe and playing the games correctly
- Basic housekeeping of the shop
- Opening and closing of the shop
- Checking of gadgets and props to ensure games run smoothly


Here's what we're looking for in an outstanding individual to join our awesome team:
1. Reliable and responsible with good ethics
2. Energetic and enjoys interacting with customers
3. Meticulous
4. Loooooves horror, or at least is not afraid of horror themes
5. Able to work until 11pm during busy periods
6. Has good initiative
7. Able to facilitate groups of all ages and variety in number of pax
8. Able to multitask and take the lead
9. Fluently spoken in English and bilingual is a plus
10. Able to commit 2 to 3 days a week for a minimum period of 3 months

Location: The Centrepoint (Somerset MRT)

Salary: $7 to $10.50 per hour and above for part timers. We expedite increments, even for part timers who perform well.

Incentives and over time pay will be provided.

Working Hours: Morning shift: 10.30am to 5pm Afternoon shift: 5pm to 10pm or closing, For late games that ends past 11pm, we do provide transport allowances.

Benefits: Career growth for senior roles/ managerial roles, including for part-timers. We also give out incentives and over time pay.

Interested candidates, please send in your resume and a recent photo to corporate(at)trapped.sg
We look forward to hear from you!

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
