We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture
Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently
Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:
5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

2. Available Duration for Internship

4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement

title: Human Resource Intern (Jan 2024 - Jun 2024)
company_info: Sleek is the SMEs’ all-in-one digital platform. We enable entrepreneurs and investors to register their company and manage their governance, accounting, and tax compliance online. Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions so they can focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn transform them into actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate growth. We are a team of over 200 builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Australia, UK & the Philippines, committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Sleek
Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms.
We are a team of 400 builders from 18 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, India, Vietnam, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients!
We are looking for an amazingly well-rounded HR Intern to help quickly grow our business in Singapore! As a HR Intern for Sleek, you will be part of a highly collaborative, fun and amazing team and be involved in exciting HR related projects. You should be highly organised, detail-oriented and most importantly, personable and approachable. You will operate with limited guidance and have strong business partnering skills. You won't be afraid to approach new, unique problems, and you'll be capable of working with large amounts of data with high attention to detail.
By submitting a job application, you confirm that you have read and agree to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates.
Position Duties
Assisting the Head of People and Culture (SG) in all HR facets and being responsible for handling administrative tasks for the Human Resources team.
Posting job advertisements to job boards.
Assisting with the end to end recruitment process.
Responsible for keeping various documents in a proper and organised manner in the internal HR System.
Champion and incorporate our culture and values in all aspects of our work.
Assist in managing any ongoing projects and track its progress, providing updates to the Head of People and Culture (SG).
Assist in organising team and company events.
Performance Standards
Passion for People and Culture.
Highly accountable and reliable.
Able to handle confidential information.
Highly self motivated and a quick learner.
Excellent Interpersonal and Communication skills.
Possess the drive to overcome challenges in a start-up environment.
Able to commit to a 6 months internship.
Proficient in Google Suites.

More about Sleek!
At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 18 nationalities and spoken languages.
We consider the company’s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Corporate social responsibility is a passion, and as an equal opportunity employer we aim at making the world a better place. We are the 1st international incorporation and accounting brand to achieve B Corp certification status, meeting the highest standards of social and environmental impact performance. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity.
If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you!

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our Client a supply chain operator is in the midst of expanding their IT Team. This is a great opportunity to join a growing data science team IT. You will be a part of a diverse and global team that is leading the way in developing cargo solutions that make supply chains more agile, resilient, and sustainable.

Role
Data Extraction and Analysis: extract and analyse large volumes of data from various sources. He or she will gather relevant data for audit testing, identifying patterns, anomalies, and trends, and performing data-driven analysis to assess control effectiveness, detect fraud, or identify areas of risk.
Data Visualisation: create visually appealing and insightful dashboards, charts, and graphs to present audit findings and communicate complex data in a more understandable and impactful manner.
Data Analytics Tools and Techniques: use data analytics tools and techniques such as statistical analysis, regression modelling, data mining, and predictive analytics to assist internal auditors in identifying key risk indicators, conducting trend analysis, and predicting potential risks or control weaknesses.
Automation and Continuous Monitoring: automate repetitive audit tasks, such as data extraction, data cleansing, and report generation, by leveraging data analytics software or programming languages. This is to allow auditors to focus more on higher-value activities and perform continuous monitoring of key controls and indicators.
Fraud Detection and Prevention: to assist internal auditors in developing and implementing data-driven fraud detection and prevention techniques. He /she will analyze transactional data, identify suspicious patterns or outliers, and collaborate with auditors to design and implement controls that mitigate fraud risks effectively. Investigations assignments may also be conducted when required or on requests of management.
Data Governance and Data Quality: contribute to the establishment of robust data governance frameworks and data quality assurance processes and work closely with IT teams to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and availability, which is crucial for reliable audit testing and analysis.

Requirements

Education
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Management, Engineering, or a related field.
Skillsets and Experience
At least 4years of relevant working experience in data analytics, process improvement, and digital transformation.
Experience using data analytics tools and techniques to extract, analyze, and visualize large volumes of data.
Experience using robotics and intelligence tools to automate repetitive tasks and improve work processes.
Experience using business intelligence tools to create dashboards and reports that communicate data insights.
Knowledge of software (Galvanize Highbond) and analytics tools (ACL, Oracle Transaction Business Intelligence OTBI) is an advantage.
Prior experience working in Internal audit deparment would be an advantage.
APPLY NOW! Interviews are ongoing! Email to dayna.chiam@stellar-link.com

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture
Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently

title: Product Intern (6 months)
company_info: We bring innovators together to ignite ideas, form alliances and shape the business world of tomorrow.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
This is a 6-month internship starting on 1 Jan 2024

At Core Collective, we take pride in creating an environment where our employees are empowered to treat the business like their own. We offer a safe and open workplace environment that encourages everyone to express their opinions and to grow with us.

Who we are:
Since our launch in 2018, Core Collective has propelled the professional growth of hundreds of fitness and wellness practitioners and business owners, by providing a convenient and cost effective plug-and-play solution at our four centers of excellence in Singapore.

Our brand promise is that we are an organization and team dedicated to helping our residents start and grow their business by providing the widest range of flexible and premium plug & play facilities and comprehensive business support services.

Who are our residents:
In Core Collective lingo, our customers are called Residents. Personal Trainers, Chiropractors, Pilates instructors, physiotherapists, etc. are a few examples of our residents who make up the community of health and wellness professionals.

Who are our members:
Our members are clients of these professionals who treat / train them in Core Collective.

Your impact:
As a product intern, you will be working on Core Collective’s new Customer Management System (CMS) which is a combination of three products - Resident Mobile Application, Member Mobile Application and the Admin Panel. The responsibility of the intern coming into this role is to focus on conducting testing for all three software products to ensure that they are fit for purpose.

What you'll be doing:
Conduct manual user acceptance testing based on end to end business test cases and detect, report and track defects.
Conduct functional testing on digital products to ensure that all features have been developed according to business request specifications.
Work closely with product managers and internal stakeholders to ensure that UAT is completed within a set timeframe.
Prepare weekly and daily bug fix reports for overall project timeline tracking purposes.
Participate in other launch and deployment activities. (not limited to manual documentation, data cleaning and migration)
Who you are:
Currently undertaking a degree or diploma in computer engineering/computer science.
Currently undertaking a degree in business or economics or other related fields.
Able to multitask and have good time management.
Good organizational skills with an eye for detail.
A good problem solver with analytical skills
Able to communicate in both verbal and documentation effectively
Proactive and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment
Nice to have:
Experience in automated testing
Experience with JIRA
Experienced in UAT testing
You are someone who takes interest in the fitness and wellness industry
What’s in it for you:
Core Collective values its employees and invests in their growth and development. You will have access to ongoing training and professional development opportunities, as well as opportunities to work on challenging and meaningful projects that contribute to the company's success.
We also offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment, where everyone's contributions are valued and where we make decisions based on our core values and what we believe to be best for our team and our customers.
Joining our company means joining a team that is passionate about making a difference and creating impact. If you share our values and are driven, creative, and committed to your personal and professional growth, you will find a home at Core Collective.
Our Vision
In line with our parent company Aurum and WH Group, our shared vision is to Build sustainable businesses that positively impact lives across generations (i.e. Do Well Do Good). We aspire to transform Core Collective from a local fitness & wellness business into leading global fitness, wellness and lifestyle hubs that are centers of excellence and home to a diverse community of top professionals, fostering collaboration for healthier and happier lives.

We achieve our vision by:
Building fitness and wellness hubs that are centers of excellence in the industry
Filling our space with the best fitness and wellness professionals
Providing the best platform and support services to help our professionals grow
Fostering collaboration across disciplines for healthier and happier lives
Our Core Values
Care (from the Heart)
Show genuine care and compassion for our team, customers, community, company
Do things because we care and not because we have to
Proactiveness to help others (team-mates/stakeholders)
Excellence
Consistently producing work that wows / impresses / delights your teammates and customers
Going above and beyond everything that we do
Continuous Improvement
Exceptional professionalism
Ownership
Treat it like your own business
Owning up to your mistakes and actively solve the mistakes
Deliver on your promises to your teammates and stakeholders
Do what needs to get done
Integrity
Always doing the right thing
Keeping to our word
Having each other’s back
Open and effective 2-way communication (both good and bad)
Treat others fairly with mutual respect
Agility
Actively seek learning and able to adapt to new situations
Able to work with people from various backgrounds, cultures and seniority

title: Group Internal Auditor (Hospitality / Property)
company_info: Founded by a team of experienced and passionate leaders in talent placement with specific knowledge in finance & accounting and human capital arena, Talenomics Pte Ltd (EA Licence No.: 19C9823) is a boutique executive search firm with strong market access to talents and career opportunities in Singapore. The purpose of our role is to drive “Talent Economics” in the talent acquisition process. We identify the right opportunity for the talent where they can maximize their economic value and connecting them to the organization that enables such value.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Company
Our client is a Hong Kong listed company with principal activities in hospitality, property investment & development and the provision of management services across the region. They are looking to hire a Group Internal Auditor to be based in Singapore.

The Role
Reporting to Senior Manager, Group Internal Audit and you shall be responsible for executing audit projects (assurance/advisory/special audits) as assigned by the Senior Manager with the following scopes:
Deploy data analytics tools for targeted risk assessments and audit testing.
Perform and document process and operations review to identify weaknesses as well as opportunities for internal control improvements, best practices, and enhancements of business processes.
Conduct audit testing to evaluate the operating effectiveness of the existing controls, assessing the compliance with the applicable policies and recommend process improvements to address control gaps and to enhance efficiency where possible.
Draft findings and recommendations in report deliverables in a clear and concise manner.
Present findings confidently and succinctly to management in closing meetings.
Perform administrative duties as part of Internal Audit team and any other tasks as assigned.
You Profile
Minimum 2-3+ years of relevant working experience i.e. External/Internal Audit experience in a Big Four/Mid-Tier Accounting firm; experience in the hospitality industry is advantageous.
Experience in North America and Asia environment is preferred.
Degree in Accountancy or equivalent such as ACCA. Professional certification such as CPA, CIA, CISA or CFE is advantageous.
Basic knowledge and experience in financial and/or operational auditing and ability to identify and document processes weaknesses and key controls lapses.
Analytical and with an eye for details.
Self-motivated and independent, strong team player, thinking out of a box and a growth mindset.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, Powerpoint, Access) with a general understanding of data analysis techniques (knowledge of Power Query is advantageous).
Excellent communication and writing skills in both English and Chinese in order to deal with Chinese stakeholders effectively for auditing entities in China.
Willingness to travel (up to 40%, 3 weeks for each project, at minimum) and flexibility to work beyond normal working hours in order to meet deadlines, as needed.

title: Internal communications specialist

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description & Requirements
Our reputable client in Singapore is seeking an Internal Communications Specialist, you will be responsible for developing and executing the internal communications strategy for our organization to ensure operational efficiency and support thought leadership. You will be responsible for creating and delivering compelling content that engages employees and strengthens the company’s culture. You will work closely with key stakeholders to ensure all internal communication is clear, consistent, and aligned with the company’s goals and values.

Responsibilities:
Develop and execute the internal communications strategy for the organization, including key messaging, communication channels, and tactics
Create and deliver internal communications content, including email updates, newsletters, intranet content, videos, and presentations
Work with key organizational stakeholders to ensure all internal communication is clear, consistent, and aligned with the company’s goals and values
Monitor and measure the effectiveness of internal communications, and make recommendations for improvement based on feedback and data analysis
Develop and maintain a content calendar to ensure that internal communications are timely and relevant • Identify opportunities to promote employee engagement and help foster a positive company culture
Design content and oversee implementation for DEIB communications, cultural and wellness calendars, meetings, and other events
Assist with crisis communications, ensuring all employees are informed and up-to-date
Maintain the company’s internal communication tools, ensuring they are up-to-date, user-friendly, and aligned with the company’s goals and values
Coordinate internal events and other initiatives to promote employee engagement and strengthen the company culture
Qualifications:
BA/BS
Minimal 3+ years of experience in internal communications, corporate communications, or related field
Excellent writing and editing skills
Excellent video content creation and editing skills
Strong project management skills
Experience with content creation and delivery, including email, newsletters, intranet content, videos, and presentations
Ability to work collaboratively with key stakeholders across the organization
Knowledge of best practices for internal communications
Strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience managing and maintaining internal communication tools is a plus (internal email software, intranet, etc.)
We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted.

Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

title: Web Developer Intern
company_info: MindFlex Education Pte Ltd is rapidly-growing Educational Business in Singapore. We are currently Singapore's #1 provider for all private & home-related tuition services in Singapore. Over the past 5 years, we have arranged more than 30,000+ tuition cases for 15,000+ happy clients. Aside from excelling in our core business, we are a people-centric company which cares deeply about the well-being and growth of our personnel. Our company culture is vibrant and exciting, with a modern office packed with exciting facilities. If you are a dynamic team-player who is passionate for growth & fulfillment, join us today! You will enjoy your time with us!
employment_type: Contract, Flexi-work, Freelance, Full Time, Internship/Attachment, Part Time, Permanent, Temporary
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture
Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently
Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:
5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep
Application:
Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Web Developer Intern Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:
1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Engineering Intern (Facility)
company_info: NatSteel traces its lineage to 1961, when it was incorporated as National Iron and Steel Mills. A pioneer and key partner in Singapore’s nation building efforts, our products are used in most construction projects island-wide, from the iconic Changi International Airport to the public housing that is the trademark of Singapore’s landscape. Singapore is home to NatSteel’s headquarters as well as its flagship plant, which boasts one of the largest single downstream rebar fabrication operations in the world. The Singapore plant is the only local steel mill with an integrated upstream and downstream operation, where steel is manufactured through recycling scrap, and fabricated according to customers’ needs.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us
Our company is a pioneering steel manufacturing business occupying several factory buildings in Jurong since 1960s. The infrastructure & facilities maintenance team is seeking interns to participate in our modernization drive as our company embarks on our next stage of growth as part of government plans to rejuvenate the Jurong Pier Industrial district.

Job Description
Interns will work under an experienced facility manager to carryout as-built survey works.
Responsibility will include site measurements, verification and updating of as-built documentation, which includes structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical, plumbing & etc
Interns will pick up valuable knowledge about as-built drawings and as-built surveys.
He or she will gain hands-on knowledge about how they are prepared, managed and used in the engineering services industry.
University level interns can also expect to learn and deliver work that’s consistent with CP83

Requirements
Study in the field of Civil/Mechanical Engineering

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Supernova
An independently owned and rapidly growing e-commerce company founded in 2013, Supernova is no stranger to the beauty industry. We are headquartered in Singapore and our offices have expanded to include Berlin, London and LA!
We're proud to present our exciting, award-winning and cult-favourite brands - Coco & Eve and Sand & Sky! Looking for hair care and body care that transports you to the Bali tropics? Coco & Eve is paradise packaged in a bottle. Eager to pamper your skin with organic Australian ingredients? Sand & Sky's got you covered. We believe in challenging ourselves, and are on a mission to create award-winning products and stay ahead of the curve with our innovative brands.
If you’re an ambitious, smart collaborator who's motivated to take ownership of innovative and industry-challenging projects, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team!

About Supernova’s Internship Programme
As an intern at Supernova, you’ll get to work directly with seasoned creatives (the best in the business!) to develop and execute exciting projects for award-winning global brands that reach over 7 million people across the globe daily. Sounds exciting? So long as you’re eager to learn, ready to challenge yourself and zealous about being a team player in a global start-up environment, we’d be thrilled to have you on board!
*Please note that this internship will ideally commence in November, lasts 6 months and would require candidates to commit to the full duration of that period.

About the Job
Our Product Development Intern will support one of the most exciting and fast-growing teams within the business, our Product Development team. This opportunity is for anyone interested in the cosmetics and wellness industry. As a Product Development Intern, you will get hands-on experience in understanding how incredible, global-dominating products are created from a simple idea. You will work closely with the Innovation, Brand and Operations teams and external manufacturers to ensure all Product development projects are carried out smoothly.

Responsibilities
Support New Product Development team in development, testing and compliance of new formulas and packaging
Assist with creation and maintenance of an organised physical and online library including all samples received, black & gold seal samples and master production samples
Maintain internal product order database which includes relevant product test results, MSDS, Finished Goods Specifications
Maintain product launch timeline and product specifications to relevant internal teams
Monitor the status of product development and follow up accordingly
Research raw materials, and physically and digitally organise samples and MSDS sheets
Assist with product feedback process - sending test product out, developing questionnaires, collecting feedback and analysing responses to help optimize formulas
Research and compile best practices for sustainability of packaging, recyclability, and alternate programs
Assist with daily administrative duties

Your Profile
Current undergraduate or recent graduate with a degree in Chemistry, Marketing, Business or similar
Confident, friendly and most importantly business savvy understanding different business models and business needs
Detail oriented, organised with a positive attitude and the ability to prioritise tasks to fit deadlines
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Proficient with G-suite, Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Relevant experience in e-commerce and project management is a bonus
Knowledge of beauty and lifestyle industries will be a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Able to commit for 5 days a week, for 6 months

In Return You Will Get
Opportunity to work with industry professionals on product formulation and product launch timelines
Flat hierarchy and co-operative working atmosphere
Freedom to execute own ideas
A fully stocked pantry!

This job has everything for the right applicant, and is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.
Only successful candidates will be contacted.

title: Intern, AI Research
company_info: Black Sesame Technologies is a technical company focused on the development of core technology and application software for visual perception. In 2016, two R&D centers in were established in Silicon Valley and Shanghai respectively. The main areas of focus are embedded image processing and computer vision. The core business of the company is to provide a complete visual perception solution, which is based on an embedded visual perception platform integrating image processing, computational imaging and artificial intelligence, for ADAS and autonomous driving. At present, the company is strategically collaborating with Bosch, Didi, Weilai, SAIC Motor, SAIC Chase, EVCARD, Thunder Software Technology, Auto-Link World, Yunle New Energy and others to provide a vision-based sensing solution for automobiles. In the field of smart phones, the dual-camera algorithm provided by Black Sesame Technologies has been mass-produced. The clients include Meizu, OPPO/VIVO, Motorola, Lenovo, Huawei and other major domestic smartphone manufacturers. In terms of image processing algorithms, the algorithm IP provided by Black Sesame Technologies has been mass-produced in the chip platform of Spreadtrum, the largest mobile platform provider in China. Xiaomi has also begun cooperation with the company in the area of image processing algorithms. In addition, the company is also getting into the field of consumer electronics, smart home and other areas to provide visual solutions for smart terminals. Black Sesame Technologies (Singapore) Pte Ltd was setup in May 2018 and its main function is to become the world leading R&D center and carry out important R&D works for the company in Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are seeking a talented and motivated AI Research Intern to join our team. This role is exclusively dedicated to research and offers a unique opportunity to collaborate with our top-tier scientists to address emerging, exciting, challenging, and real-world problems in autonomous driving. As an AI Research Intern, you will get the opportunity to pioneer research, exploring the most recent advancements in AI and machine learning. The role focuses on conceiving and designing innovative solutions that leverage AI to enhance our autonomous driving products. We provide a wealth of research resources, including established research topics, ample computational power, and access to high-quality datasets. In this role, you will have the chance to make meaningful contributions to practical AI solutions through your inventive ideas.

Responsibilities:
Engage in regular collaborative meetings with our R&D team and accomplished research scientists.
Conduct thorough literature reviews on relevant research topics to stay at the forefront of autonomous driving advancements.
Lead the development of inventive solutions to address real-world challenges in autonomous driving.
Qualification/Requirements:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Possess a solid foundation in machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision.
Demonstrated practical experience with Python and PyTorch.
Exhibit excellent problem-solving skills and a knack for creative thinking.
Showcase a proven track record of publications in reputable conferences and journals related to computer vision, machine learning, and AI. Examples of such conferences/journals include but are not limited to CVPR, ICCV, NeurIPS, T-PAMI, and others.
Internship Period & Office Hours:
Minimum 3 months; Longer internship period (e.g., 6 months) will be preferred.
Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 5.30pm
Join us in pushing the boundaries of AI research and making a significant impact on the future of autonomous driving. If you are passionate about innovation and eager to contribute your expertise to our team, we encourage you to apply for this exciting internship opportunity.

title: Sales Development Intern
company_info: No information added.
address: Raffles City Tower, 250 North Bridge Road 179101
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Have you imagined pursuing a career in tech sales? Selling may sound intimidating, and you might not have gone thru any learnings in school on the know-hows – here’s your chance to step into an enterprise organization to gain real-world experience to grow your interpersonal and business skills. These skills will provide access to career development opportunities at CyberArk that allow you to be a part of something bigger than just a job.
What you can expect from this program:
Start and End Date: This full-time internship program will begin Jan 2024 - June 2024
The goal of this 6 months hands-on sales development internship is to provide you a platform to gain valuable experience in the field of sales development in the growing cybersecurity landscape. We are looking for talented and driven individuals to join our team who are interested in pursuing a career in sales development, account management or channel sales with a passion to establish your footing in the growing technology market. You will be exposed to real business situations with coaching from SDR/SDR Leaders to take through your successes and challenges with a continuous feedback culture to help you take the maximum from this experience.
Apart from topic specific trainings on sales development, you will be engaged in a holistic internship program where you are mentored by SDR and SDR leadership, have exchanges with leaders in the organization and collaborate & lead impactful company-wide CSR activities
Impact You’ll Own:
As a Sales Development Intern, some specific tasks that you may be involved include:
Develop and execute strategies to identify and generate target personas of CyberArk products and solutions
Gets hands-on on how to read a lead, developing talk track and outreach email, and form discovery questions
Analysis of current outreach tools including ZoomInfo, 6Sense, Outreach and Drift, and develop strategies to help optimize the results from the usage of the tools by the Sales Development team
In addition to these specific tasks, you may also be involved in attending qualifying conversation, discovery meetings, shadowing experienced SDRs, and participating in training sessions to develop your skills in sales and customer success.
A successful sales development intern will look like,
A strong communicator who is inquisitive and hungry to learn
Highly organized, independent operator who work well in a team
Creative to bring in fresh ideas and not afraid to express your ideas
Comfortable with technology and be interested in learning about the latest trends in the industry
We do not require specific academic majors or industry experience but if you are pursuing a courses related to business/marketing/technology or have prior sales/tech internship experience you will have an edge over others!

Charterhouse Partnership is currently partnering an international Brokerage to source for a Compliance Manager. As part of their expansion plan in Asia, this will be a new headcount in Singapore. Reporting to the APAC Head of Legal and Compliance, you will manage the regulatory compliance framework and policies.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The incumbent will assist in reviewing, assessing and implement regulatory change impacting the entity. You will take ownership in managing the Compliance Review Program to ensure internal departments are compliant with rules, policies and procedures.
You will be responsible in preparing of compliance training materials and ensure mandatory training requirements are met by employees and licenses representatives.
You will also be required to interpret regulations and rules affecting business transactions and practices.

Degree with minimum 5 years of retail compliance/audit experience at a financial services regulator, exchange/trading venue or similar experience
Prior working experience in Dealing Desk operation will be a strong plus
Good understanding of Singapore regulations, notices and guidelines, relating to ASIC and Capital Markets Services License would be an advantage.
Strong communication skills with ability to positively influence senior management.
For more information on the above position, or to discuss the compliance market in general, please send your CV to Xuan Kwok at XuanK@charterhouse.com.sg or call 6950 0354 for a confidential discussion.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
We are seeking a motivated and enthusiastic Human Resource Intern to join our team in NatSteel. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience and contribute to various HR functions within our organization. You will work closely with the HR team to support and assist with daily activities, projects, and initiatives.

Job Description
Mapping of HR Work Processes and involvement in the implementation of new HRIS:
Working with each function of HR to map out the work processes
Assist in the migration work to the new Performance Management System
Support the implementation of HRIS
Employee Relations:
Help with updating and disseminating company policies and procedures.
Support employee engagement initiatives, such as organizing team-building activities and employee recognition programs.
Provide general administrative support to the HR team.
Assist in generating HR reports and analytics.
Help with HR-related projects, such as policy revisions or process improvements.
Recruitment and On-boarding:
Screen resumes and applications and conduct initial phone screenings.
Schedule and coordinate interviews with candidates.
Assist in conducting reference checks.
Support the on-boarding process for new hires, including preparing orientation materials and coordinating induction sessions.

Requirements
Currently pursuing a diploma/degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field (or recently graduated).
Knowledge or coursework in HR principles and practices.
Attention to detail and ability to maintain confidentiality.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

title: Personal Banker | International Bank
company_info: The Adecco Group is the world's leading provider of HR solutions. The services we offer fall into the broad categories of temporary staffing, permanent placement, career transition and talent development, as well as outsourcing and consulting. The Adecco Group is based in Zurich-Glattbrugg, Switzerland and we are a Fortune Global 500 company listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange.

about the job

Serving retail clients and providing expert advice on the wide range of banking products offered by the bank.
Proactively engaging clients through various touchpoints such as branch banking, tele-appointments, and outreach programs.
Leveraging your sound financial knowledge to offer holistic financial advice and identify suitable banking solutions that help clients achieve their financial goals.
Demonstrating a good understanding of banking regulations, ensuring strict adherence to rules and guidelines while conducting business.
Joining this leading international bank means you'll have access to a wealth of opportunities for personal and professional growth. The bank values resilience and motivation, and it provides comprehensive support to help you thrive in your role. With excellent interpersonal and communication skills, you will have the chance to build strong relationships with clients while making a meaningful difference in their financial journey.
skills and experience required

Aside from excelling in our core business, we are a people-centric company which cares deeply about the well-being and growth of our personnel. Our company culture is vibrant and exciting, with a modern office packed with exciting facilities. If you are a dynamic team-player who is passionate for growth & fulfillment, join us today! You will enjoy your time with us!
employment_type: Contract, Flexi-work, Freelance, Full Time, Internship/Attachment, Part Time, Permanent, Temporary
job_category: Admin / Secretarial, Customer Service, Education and Training, Human Resources, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Find Out Even More At: https://tinyurl.com/mindflex-intern
Hi! Our company is looking for Polytechnic/University Interns who are able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 Months & Above (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships that are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our play seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a cosy office environment with modern facilities such as a PS5, pool table, karaoke system & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly no over-time culture, no bring-work-home culture
Learning Scope:
Complete experience of sales & operations process (initial touch-base with clients, order preparation, invoicing, after-sales service)
Enjoy first-hand & real-world experience with actual customer communication, unique problem solving & critical thinking
Exposure to real-life and practical marketing tools such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Carousell Ads, SEO (Ahrefs, SEMRush)
Learn & experience how to use customised back-end software which have been specially designed & tailored to fulfill the company's business needs & improve efficiency
Be involved in company's business development through assigned projects with fellow interns
Be exposed to application & conceptualisation of business strategies from the perspective of market leaders in the tuition industry
Job scope will be a 70-30% split between Operations & Marketing tasks
Responsibilities:
Be actively involved with Business & Marketing Operations of an Educational Agency on a day-to-day basis
Communicate well with new clients (warm leads), engaging them & helping them to understand better their tuition needs
Prepare client's requirements & present them in an attractive yet concise job-post format for tutors to apply in
Be in charge of filtering & broadcasting available tuition assignments via the company's various outreach channels (WhatsApp, Telegram, Email & many more)
Assist in actively profiling tutors and marketing them in a way which captures the consumer's attention based on their required needs
Assist in sales-closing & after-sales process. Work cohesively with other team members to solve unique day-to-day problems
Assist in Digital Marketing Tasks such as creating engaging Facebook & Instagram Posts
Actively involved in active link-building and outreach campaigns to improve company's internet presence
Assist with content creation on company's website through web building tools such as WordPress
Job Requirements:
Current Polytechnic/University Student, Singaporean
Good Command of Both Written & Verbal English
Friendly, Passionate and Energetic Team Player
Organized and Good Administrative Skills
Responsible and Strong Work Ethic
Decent Typing Speed and Computer Skills
Polite, Patient and Calm Personality
Location & Working Hours:
Location: Sin Ming Lane, Midview City (Near Bishan/Marymount MRT)
4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend, 9.00am - 6.30pm
(Working days of your choosing & mutually agreed with the company)
Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture
Internship Allowance:
$800/Month (Polytechnic)
$1,000/Month (University)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Company Culture and Working Environment
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Office with Modern Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep
Application:
Submit an e-mail application with Resume/CV to mindflex.recruitment@gmail.com with Email Title "Internship Application"
Please ensure to include the following in Email and attached documents:
1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:
Shortlisted candidates will be contacted for a short interview over Zoom or Face-to-Face
Signing of Non-Compete contract will be required upon successful selection

title: Influencer Marketing Intern - Sand & Sky
company_info: About Supernova We are the fastest growing health & beauty social e-commerce company. We build health and beauty products for a new generation of women worldwide. Independently owned with a global marketing reach and offices in London, Singapore, New Delhi and Melbourne, we connect with over 12 million women on social media every week. About Supernova’s Internal Engine Together we create Superstars! Our three company pillars are guided by this motto: Our product and brands are of the highest quality and within the top five in their category; our customers are the focus of our actions and their lives improve with our products; our talent and employees grow and develop within Supernova. This means that investing in hiring, developing and retaining the brightest minds in the world is a top priority. Living our core values of #GetSh*tDone, #TalkAboutIt, #CreateValue, #SeekNewOpportunities and #MoveForwardTogether creates a unique culture across five different time zones and allows us to realise the enormous potential of this exciting industry. If you’re an ambitious, smart, natural collaborator who likes taking risks, influencing, and innovating in a challenging hyper-growth environment, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team.
job_category: Marketing / Public Relations, Personal Care / Beauty
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Supernova
An independently owned and rapidly growing e-commerce company founded in 2013, Supernova is no stranger to the beauty industry. We are headquartered in Singapore and our offices have expanded to include Berlin, London and LA!
We're proud to present our exciting, award-winning and cult-favourite brands - Coco & Eve and Sand & Sky! Looking for haircare and body care that transports you to the Bali tropics? Coco & Eve is paradise packaged in a bottle. Eager to pamper your skin with organic Australian ingredients? Sand & Sky's got you covered. We believe in challenging ourselves, and are on a mission to create award winning products and stay ahead of the curve with our innovative brands.
If you’re an ambitious, smart collaborator who's motivated to take ownership of innovative and industry-challenging projects, we’d love to talk to you about joining our team!

About Supernova’s Internship Programme
As an intern at Supernova, you’ll get to work directly with seasoned creatives (the best in the business!) to develop and execute exciting projects for award-winning global brands that reach over 7 million people across the globe daily. Sounds exciting? So long as you’re eager to learn, ready to challenge yourself and zealous about being a team player in a global start-up environment, we’d be thrilled to have you on board!
* This internship will ideally commence as soon as possible and would require candidates to commit to the full duration of that period.

About Sand & Sky
Do you want to be a part of the skincare brand that is taking social media and the beauty industry by storm? Committed to uncomplicated skincare, our goal is to reinvent and elevate our customers' skincare regimes with the most effective formulas and fuss-free routines. This is your chance to join the beauty and ecommerce sensation that delivers powerful yet environmentally-conscious products!
Sand & Sky is proudly born in Australia and our cruelty-free, strictly no-nasties formulas use Australian native botanicals to help people achieve their best skin yet.

About the Job
We are looking for an organised and agile intern to join our growing team in Singapore. You’ll be on the frontline of our social media strategies, building and maintaining relationships with bloggers and other influencers. You love all things “celebrity” and “social” and know exactly who is currently ‘hot or not’ and who is ‘up and coming’.

Responsibilities
Managing daily communication with a large number of micro influencers - must have professional communication skills to represent the Sand & Sky team
Monitoring incoming responses from participants willing to take part in the content creation programme (via Google Forms or Aspire-IQ influencer platform)
Pinpointing which influencers are viable to work with based on certain KPI’s
Tracking the campaign progress
Ensure that products are accurately shipped to influencers and that content is received on time
Tracking content posting and performance metrics
Searching for new faces and influencers to bring the brand to new audiences
Sourcing content for specific social media campaigns
Assisting with social media strategy to increase the brand's reach and engagement
Helping to create organic content for Tiktok and Instagram

Your Profile
1 internship with relevant work experience is a plus
Great people skills
Ability to convey ideas in a clear and concise way, both verbally and in writing
Positive thinking, creative, cheerful, fun-loving character
Organised and proven attention to detail
A working knowledge of major social media channels including Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, TikTok
Analytical mind with the ability to monitor, interpret and report campaign results
Must commit for 5 days a week, for 6 Months

In Return You Will Get
Mentorship from industry experts
Flat hierarchy and co-operative international working environment
Freedom to execute own ideas
Opportunity to convert to full-time on completion of successful internship

This job has everything for the right applicant, and is available immediately. All applications will be treated confidentially.
Only successful candidates will be contacted.
Supernova is an equal opportunity employer. Our values define the working culture and environment we strive to create – fair, diverse, respectful and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. We promote harmonious working relationships and encourage a learning and development culture. We welcome applications from talented people coming from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
See our Applicant Data Protection policy for information on how we collect, use and process your personal data: https://supernovabrands.com/applicant-data-protection-notice/

title: Consultant, International Tax and Transaction Services
company_info: EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The exceptional EY experience. It's yours to build.
The opportunity: your next adventure awaits

Dear all,
The partners and team in EY International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS) invite you to join us and be part of an era of transformative tax journey.
Today, we see innovative business models continually emerge as countries face structural challenges and trends, such as climate change, acceleration of digitisation, and changing consumer behavior. These, together with the evolving global tax reforms like BEPS 2.0, have increased the complexities of doing business.
This era of changes sees Tax increasingly forming part of businesses’ boardroom agenda.
In EY International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS), we provide flexible opportunities for you to hone single, dual or multi-disciplinary tax skillsets, be it corporate and international tax advisory, transaction tax advisory, business incentives advisory and/ or transfer pricing.
You will work with our ITTS engagement teams on those tax advisory projects, helping businesses as they go through various aspects of their life or growth cycle – establishment, expansion, transformation, exit, in domestic or international markets, for example:
Advise on market entry or exit tax issues and workarounds
Review their legal entity structure and/ or transactional/ operating model
Help them manage tax risks by looking at their overall tax strategy, governance and tax risk management framework
Understand business objectives and their value drivers to help align their tax and operating model, and optimize tax opportunities like research & development grants or deductions, incentives or other forms of government support
For mergers and acquisitions, advise on acquisition, disposal, refinancing, restructuring or initial public offering. And to help with negotiations throughout the transaction life cycle, from initial due diligence to post-deal implementation
Cross border multi-country projects to help businesses navigate through the evolving and changing global tax landscape, be it tax and transfer pricing restructuring, tax disputes, or BEPS 2.0.
What we look for
You are curious about tax
You look forward to tax challenges within the today’s fast-moving world of business
You see change as the only constant – you want to be there as the global tax landscape evolves
You are agile – you can be a strategic thinker, have precision in execution, yet pragmatic in solutions, and an inclusive collaborator
You have a growth mindset – you desire specialism, yet keen to build skillsets beyond your core
You have grit – you aspire to be a trusted advisor
Qualifications and skills
A degree related to Accountancy / Finance / Tax / Business / Economics / Engineering / Information Technology; a CPA, CA or similar certification
At least 1 year of relevant experience for experienced associate role, at least 3 years of experience for consultant role
An open mind and the ability to adapt and perform under pressure
Problem solving and numerical skills
Time and project management skills
Effective and impactful communication skills (written, verbal, relationship building)
What we can offer
A competitive remuneration package – Rewarding individual and team performance.
Flexible working arrangements – FlexTime, FlexPlace, FlexSpace, FlexWork, FlexAttire
Dynamic, diverse and inclusive culture – Embracing you for who you are. Empowering you to use your voice to help others find theirs.
Support for continuous learning - Developing mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next
Success as defined by you – Providing the platform, tools and flexibility in ITTS, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Authentic & transformative leadership – Sharing experiences and insights, one-on-one coaching journey to help you hone next-generation leadership skills
Mobility/ secondment programmes – providing opportunities for you to acquire broader experiences and exposures
On behalf of fellow ITTS partners and colleagues, we look forward to having you with us.
Best regards,
Florence Loh
Partner, EY International Tax and Transactions Services Leader
https://www.ey.com/en_sg/people/florence-loh

title: Manager, International Tax and Transaction Services
company_info: EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Today, we see innovative business models continually emerge as countries face structural challenges and trends, such as climate change, acceleration of digitisation, and changing consumer behavior. These, together with the evolving global tax reforms like BEPS 2.0, have increased the complexities of doing business.
You would have observed – Tax is increasingly forming part of businesses’ boardroom agenda. Our partners and colleagues in EY International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS) invite professionals like yourselves to join our growing team and be part of an era of transformative tax journey.
In EY International Tax and Transaction Services (ITTS), we provide flexible opportunities for you to hone single, dual or multi-disciplinary tax skillsets, be it corporate and international tax advisory, transaction tax advisory, business incentives advisory and/ or transfer pricing.
Our diverse international and domestic client base span across industries and sectors, providing you with vast opportunities for exposure, for depth, across competencies, across geographies. You will work with our ITTS partners and lead engagement project teams to help businesses as they go through various aspects of their life or growth cycle. Establish. Expand. Transform. Exit.
You will be involved in:
Cross border multi-jurisdictional tax and transfer pricing projects as businesses restructure or transform amidst the evolving and changing global tax landscape, especially with BEPS 2.0 and the increasing levels of tax disputes across countries and regions.
Identifying market entry or exit tax issues and workarounds. Legal entity rationalization. Transactional or operating model design, review and implementation. Tax governance and tax risk management.
Understanding development objectives and value drivers of businesses, e.g. headquarters functions, centres of excellence, manufacturing and distribution activities, finance and treasury operations, intangible property, incentives, etc, and helping them achieve sustainability with the alignment of their tax and operating model. In addition, to also help strategise, plan and apply for research and development grants or deductions, incentives or other forms of government support, where required
Where mergers and acquisitions take place, advising companies and private equity investors on all tax aspects of their transactions - acquisition, disposal, refinancing, restructuring or initial public offering. And helping with negotiations throughout the transaction life cycle, from initial due diligence to post-deal implementation

You are confident of facing tax challenges within the today’s fast-moving world of business
You see change as the only constant – you want to be there as the global tax landscape evolves
You are agile – you can be a strategic thinker, have precision in execution, yet pragmatic in tax solutions, and an inclusive collaborator
You have a growth mindset – you desire specialism, yet keen to deepen and strengthen skillsets beyond your core
You have grit – you aspire to be a multidisciplinary tax advisor, a trusted problem solver
Qualifications and skills
A degree related to Accountancy / Finance / Tax /Business / Economics / Engineering / Information Technology; a CPA, CA or similar certification
At least 5 years of relevant experience for manager role, at least 8 years of experience for senior manager role
Solid foundation in complex tax and/ or transfer pricing advisory, international tax matters, treaty related issues, disputes, BEPS knowledge, etc.
An open mind and the ability to lead with confidence, influence and inspire the next generation, adapt and perform under pressure
Problem solving, time and project management skills
Effective and impactful communication and presentation skills (written, verbal, relationship building)
What we can offer
A very competitive remuneration package – Rewarding individual and team performance.
Flexible working arrangements – FlexTime, FlexPlace, FlexSpace, FlexWork, FlexAttire
Dynamic, diverse and inclusive culture – Embracing you for who you are. Empowering you to use your voice to help others find theirs.
