title: 6 Months Marketing Intern (Moist Diane & Laundrin) Full time (Jan to Jun 24)
company_info: MANDOM CORPORATION (SINGAPORE) PRIVATE LIMITED The Mandom Group generates value by leveraging the creativity of employees in its products and services. We engage in our daily business activities under the basic commitment of contributing to a comfortable life of consumers around the world.
address: GREAT WORLD CITY, 1 KIM SENG PROMENADE 237994
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us

Founded in 1927, Mandom Corporation is a Japanese manufacturer and distributor of consumer products. From hair wax, cosmetics to shampoo, there is something for everyone to meet their daily needs. Some of the brands under our belt are: GATSBY, LUCIDO-L, Moist Diane and Heroine Make. As a company which focuses on Oyakudachi (dedication to service), we strive to provide the best quality products at affordable prices to consumers.

What to expect

As our Marketing intern, you will get to work on brands under the haircare and homecare categories. The brands you will be assisting in are: Moist Diane and Laundrin.

Under the guidance of experienced marketers, you will get to understand the internal workings of the Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry, and be introduced to the world of digital and trade marketing. Aside from being involved in the conceptualization and execution of marketing campaigns, you will also play a key role in ensuring that the day to day operations within the marketing teams runs smoothly.

This is the perfect opportunity to understand how the textbook theories you are studying now can be applied to the real world.

Keen to embark on this rewarding and insightful journey? Send in your resumes now!


You will be assisting the Haircare and Homecare team in the following areas:

Digital Marketing

· Manage brands’ social media platforms and monthly content calendar (Instagram, Facebook, Tiktok, Lemon8)
· Assist in developing and designing digital marketing materials
· Create content to strengthen brands’ SEO performance and drive organic traffic to brands’ websites
· Analyse digital marketing trends to improve brands’ performance in digital communications

Trade Marketing

· Conceptualize and develop visually impactful designs for in store displays and events
· Provide support for trade marketing needs to enhance store visibility and exposure
· Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to roll out marketing projects

Campaign Management

· Assist in marketing campaigns in areas such as developing campaign communications, PR management etc

Data Analysis

· Conduct competitor analysis to understand the retail landscape
· Conduct market research to understand more about the haircare and homecare landscapes to identify consumer trends

Operational Support

· Support the marketing teams in daily administrative tasks
· Prepare presentations and monthly reports
· Assist in any other ad hoc tasks assigned

Who we are looking for

· Undergraduates majoring in Marketing / Communications and New Media
· Able to commit full-time from January to June 2024
· Possess a strong passion in the Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) industry, as well as the haircare and homecare industries
· Possess strong analytical skills, good interpersonal, communication and writing skills
· Has an eye for details and aesthetics
· Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills, with an ability to prioritize time-sensitive tasks
· A motivated team-player who is creative, meticulous, resourceful and is able to work independently
· Familiarity with social media management (Instagram, Facebook, Tiktok) is a plus
· Knowledge and experience in graphics creation softwares, such as Canva, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator etc is a plus

Using a secret recipe thoughtfully formulated, our traditional soup broth is slow boiled using fresh ingredients that are handpicked with care. The results – a rich and full-bodied Lao Jiang’s Signature Superior Soup that leaves an aromatic aftertaste on your tastebud. For years, we paired our traditional delicacies with homemade special sauces and simple cooking methods, resulting in each dish with its own unique flavour – Especially the popular “Signature Superior Soup with Dry Hor Fun” and “Lao Jiang Zhu-Jiao-Chu” Friends who dine with us can enjoy our nostalgic delicacies with warmth and happiness, revelling in the aroma and taste and remembering the Lao Jiang Superior Soup Brand.

title: R0263332 - International Private Bank Agile - Lending & Deposits Business Analyst - AVP
company_info: About Deutsche Bank A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team
At Deutsche Bank Wealth Management, we want to fundamentally improve the way our clients perceive our offering. To this end, we must develop outstanding technical solutions and competitive products that enable a unique, end-to-end client experience that’s driven by client demand.
To achieve this, we want to become the world's first Agile wealth manager: By adopting new ways of working, we will further enhance the value we create for our clients and enable faster delivery. Cross-functional, multi-disciplinary squads work independently, applying Agile working methods to implement the assigned goals. And as they do, they create a working environment where employees work self-directed in organizational structures that allow for fast learning, nimble adjustments and further individual development.
Purpose of the role
The Business Analyst supports the Product Owner and the entire Lending & Deposits APAC squad in preparing and delivering requirements, specifics and other information or data. The job of the BA is essential in delivering high quality products and in supporting the squad by having all documentation detailed and well prepared.
What we will offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities
Lead and facilitate discussions with multiple stakeholders to understand and identify gaps or inefficiencies in the current way of working.
Drive optimization by identifying areas of opportunity, defining and planning projects to improve performance.
Leading testing and implementation activities, including coordinating user acceptance testing and executing user training.
Provide regular project updates and achieve buy-in from impacted stakeholders as required.
Establish & manage relationships with key stakeholders to understand critical business needs.
Engage with business stakeholders and delivery team members across the globe to deliver solutions.
Your skills and experience
A minimum of 7+ years of experience delivering high-impact projects, or possessing an equivalent background in implementation or management consulting
Experience in the Private Banking/Wealth Management domain and related support functions, understanding of Credit Risk Management, Lending & Deposit products and business processes.
Possess strong facilitation and data gathering skills, able to lead project working groups
Bachelor, Master/MBA in relevant field e.g. Business Management
Track record of having delivered significant changes to processes, technology, and ways of working that delivered value to the business and increased efficiency and effectiveness of an organization
Advanced communication skills, including an ability to influence others and understanding how people go through a change and the change process
Possess strong facilitation and data gathering skills, able to lead project working groups
High level of attention to detail, hands-on mentality and pro-active attitude
Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously coupled with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/ global organisations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing
A team player who continually collaborates and shares information
Fluent in English (written/ verbal)
Good knowledge of business analysis methods and tools (Agile, Waterfall, Jira, Confluence, MS Office)
Experience in Agile ways of working with strong ability to apply Design Thinking methodologies and techniques (such as User Personas, User Journey, Minimum Viable Products / Experiments)
Ability to communicate in a concise & precise manner on business topics
Comfortable working with ambiguity
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirements may apply.
How we’ll support you
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Copy Intern
company_info: CWO - Creative agency specialising in using social tools to shape consumerism Website - http://cwo.sg or instagram.com/cwo.sg Clients - Grab, Lazada, Unilever, Amazon
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Launch Your Advertising Career: Become a Copy Intern with CWO!
Job Highlights:
Attractive Salary Package
Positive Working Environment
Career Growth & Development
Note: This position offers an exclusive opportunity for growth with mentorship
About CWO:

CWO is a pioneering creative agency that specializes in harnessing the power of social tools to shape consumerism. We're on a mission to redefine the advertising landscape through innovative campaigns that capture hearts and minds.

Our Esteemed Clients:
Grab
Lazada
Unilever
Amazon
Learn More About Us: cwo.sg or instagram.com/cwo.sg

Position: Copy Intern

Scope:

As a Copy Intern, you'll dive into the world of crafting compelling narratives and engaging content. You'll be at the forefront of our creative endeavors, conceptualizing ideas, and creating slogans for dynamic digital campaigns. Your role will extend to crafting scripts for captivating social content and crafting text for impactful print advertising.
No Prior Experience Required: You don't need to come in with a portfolio or years of experience. We value your potential and enthusiasm!
Guided Learning: Our role is designed for newcomers to the world of copywriting. You'll receive thorough guidance and training from experienced professionals.
Mentorship: You'll be paired with a mentor who will help you develop your skills, answer your questions, and guide you through the creative process.
Hands-On Experience: You'll have the opportunity to work on real projects, giving you practical exposure to the world of advertising and copywriting.
Constructive Feedback: We believe in growth through feedback. Your mentor and team will provide valuable insights to help you refine your craft.
What We're Seeking:
Creative Expression: You possess the ability to develop ingenious ideas and translate them into persuasive copy, captivating stories, memorable taglines, and effective calls to action.
Brand Consistency: You'll ensure that all copy aligns seamlessly with our clients' brand guidelines and maintains the desired tone of voice.
Passion for Social Media: Your enthusiasm for social media marketing and platforms is essential. Your insights into consumer behavior in the digital realm will set you apart.
Communication Maven: Your strong communication skills will empower you to collaborate effectively within a team and deliver your ideas succinctly.
Consumer Insights: Your knack for understanding what resonates with consumers will contribute to the impact of our campaigns.
Visual Communication: You have the unique ability to express abstract concepts visually, enhancing the effectiveness of your copy.
Attention to Detail: You'll meticulously proofread your copy, ensuring impeccable spelling and grammar.
What You Bring:
Collaborative Spirit: You excel in a team environment and thrive under deadlines, contributing to our collective success.
Articulate Skills: Your verbal and written communication skills are your superpower, allowing you to craft persuasive copy.
Bonus Skill: Proficiency in phone photography and videography is an added advantage.
Curiosity in Trends: Your keen interest in technology, social media, digital content, and popular culture drives your innovative ideas.
Perks of Joining Our Team:
Collaborative Environment: Immerse yourself in a vibrant team of young, creative, and dynamic individuals.
Positive Atmosphere: Experience a work environment that encourages innovation and creativity.
Convenient Location: Our office is conveniently located near the MRT station, making your commute a breeze.
Growth Opportunities: Exceptional performance may lead to conversion into full-time roles or annual salary increments.
Ready to Take the Next Step?
Application: If you're a creative wordsmith with a passion for the art of storytelling, send in your cover letter, resume, and a portfolio showcasing your creative prowess.
Note: Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

Elevate your creativity and embark on an exciting journey with us. Apply now to become a Copy Intern and contribute to our mission of shaping consumerism through captivating storytelling!

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Hi! Our awesome company is looking for University Interns who have experience in Web Development, & able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 months or more (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships which are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our fun seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a modern office environment with exciting facilities, such as a PS5, Full-Sized Pool Table, High-End Karaoke System & more
Close-knit team of 15-20 pax, strictly NO office politics, NO over-time culture, NO bring-work-home culture
Web Developer Intern Roles and Responsibilities:
Improve & automate company's business process through creation of new PHP web applications & improvement of existing code.
Review of company's existing process systems to improve UI/UX for both internal and external users.
Be involved in improvement of company's iOS & Android application
Connecting SQL Databases to developed web applications
Review and improve company's current cronjobs and APIs for both internal and external software.
Ensure that new projects are moved from development phase to production phase smoothly, and are both desktop & mobile friendly.
Spearhead development of new landing pages for company's website on WordPress platform, with usage of HTML & CSS code involved.
Modify and improve current landing pages for company's website, with the addition of new functionalities.
Data mining of websites and database for information to be used in company's IT projects.
Learning Outcomes & Objectives:
Intern will be exposed to the movement of IT projects from development phase to production phase in a systematic & meticulous manner.
Intern will have the first-hand experience of building code which can be translated into real-world business usage, to solve actual business problems.
Intern will learn how to manage expectations of different stakeholders, in particular balancing between "design wants" of the company and limitations of existing web platforms.
Intern will gain valuable first-hand experience of developing mobile applications, as well as creating new website landing pages from scratch in a professional setting.
Intern will gain insights on mining data content and using it for real-life application purposes.
Intern will be able to review and suggest opinions on how certain UI/UX interfaces of the company can be improved, and carry out plans for improvement.
Intern will also be able to review codes and script written by previous developers; learning from examples and improvement on existing code.
Intern will also have access to a "senior developer" who will be able to answer queries & troubleshoot whever necessary
Requirements:
Has to be a current University Undergraduate in a computing-related course
Possess some previous experience with website designing / programming
Proficient with PHP, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Languages
A good team player who is able to communicate effectively with various internal and external stakeholders
Ability to think critically and be able to suggest possible improvements to existing company software systems
Possess adequate problem-solving skills to tackle day-to-day issues independently
Working Hours, Location & Remuneration:
5 Days Work Week, Weekdays 9.00am - 6.30pm
Midview City (Sin Ming Lane)
Closest MRTs: Bright-Hill MRT (Door-Step), Bishan / Marymount MRT (nearby)
$1,000 - $1,200/Month
Interns will also be given several days of paid leave (depending on internship period)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics!
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games...etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities
Great & Enjoyable Company Culture
Many of our interns have also converted to full-time & contract positions after their internship as they thoroughly enjoyed their learning experience with us
Conveniently located with New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

title: Video Production Intern
company_info: Ground Zero Media is a dynamic and innovative media production company based in the vibrant city of Singapore. Our name, inspired by the concept of starting from scratch, signifies our commitment to pushing the boundaries of creativity and delivering impactful media solutions. With a passionate team of skilled professionals, we offer a comprehensive range of media production services tailored to meet the diverse needs of our clients. Our services span across various mediums, including video production, photography, and social media management services. Whether you require captivating commercials, engaging corporate videos, immersive documentaries, or social media managing services, we have the skills and tools to exceed your expectations.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Title: Video Production Intern

Location: Woodlands

Job Type: Full-time (5 Days) Mon – Fri (9 am – 5 pm)

Job Summary: Assisting in-house videographers/editors for video projects: product/services videos, corporate videos, in-house content videos, and other types of projects. This includes operating cameras during multi-cam productions. During onsite sessions, assistance is provided to the production team in various areas such as equipment setup and organization, prop handling, camera operation, lighting, and sound equipment. Additionally, creative input is given during brainstorming sessions to contribute to the project's overall vision. Furthermore, active participation is required in pre-production activities like conceptualization and storyboarding of projects.

Responsibilities:
• Assisting with video shoots:
• Setting up and organizing equipment, including cameras, lighting, and audio gear.
• Assisting the production team during shoots, such as handling props, operating cameras, and managing equipment.

Editing and post-production:
• Reviewing raw footage and selecting the best takes for further editing.
• Trimming and rearranging footage to create a cohesive story or message.
• Enhancing video and audio quality through color correction, audio mixing, and other editing techniques.
• Incorporating graphics, animations, and visual effects when necessary.
• Working closely with the video production team to understand project requirements and objectives.
• Providing creative input and suggestions during brainstorming sessions.
• Communicating effectively with team members to ensure smooth workflow and timely completion of projects.

Learning and development:
• Keeping up-to-date with the latest trends and techniques in video production and editing.
• Seeking opportunities to expand your skills and knowledge in video-related areas.
• Actively participating in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions.

Requirements:
• Currently pursuing or recently completed a diploma/degree in film production, video editing, multimedia, or a related field.
• Previous experience with video production and editing, either through coursework, internships, or personal projects, is preferred but not mandatory.
• Interest in video-related production work is a plus.

Technical skills:
• Proficiency in video editing software such as Adobe Premiere Pro, or similar tools.
• Basic knowledge of camera operation, lighting setups, and audio recording.
• Familiarity with visual effects, motion graphics, and color correction techniques is a plus.

Creative and interpersonal skills:
• Strong creative thinking and storytelling abilities.
• Attention to detail and the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously.
• Effective communication and collaboration skills within a team environment.
• Willingness to learn, take feedback, and adapt to evolving project needs.

This video intern position offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in video production and editing while working in a professional setting. You will have the chance to contribute to the creation of compelling video content and develop your skills alongside experienced professionals in the field

title: Digital Marketing Intern
company_info: Company overview Founded by GJ Wee, Trapeze is a fitness / wellness / health company founded in Singapore. We are building a portfolio of brands that help people find and maintain wellbeing in a playful, innovative, and holistic way. The company’s first concept is Trapeze Rec. Club, a holistic wellness club located along Tanjong Pagar Road that features a cafe, fitness & yoga studios, thermal suite and consultation spaces.
job_category: Information Technology, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Trapeze was born with the intention to help people find and maintain wellbeing in a playful, innovative, and holistic way. We aim to build a portfolio of brands under Trapeze, starting with a wellness members club concept called Trapeze Rec. Club (TRC) that launched in 2021 with fitness, martial arts, & yoga classes, recovery facilities such as a cold plunge & sauna, infrared sauna, compression therapy, consultation services like TCM, physiotherapy, mental wellbeing, and an in-house cafe, Canteen.
With that in mind, we are looking for an enthusiastic Digital Marketing Intern to join our team. You will play a crucial role in helping us reach and engage with our target audience through various digital channels, assist in creating compelling and impactful content, managing our social media platforms, conducting market research, and supporting other digital marketing initiatives. The Marketing Intern will report directly to the Marketing Lead and the Digital Marketing Manager.
The candidate should be able to provide creative ideas to help achieve our goals and will assist in developing and implementing marketing strategies.

Job Scope
Content Creation:
Collaborate with the marketing team to develop and produce high-quality visual and written content for our digital platforms.
Assist in filming or shooting content for social media, website, and other marketing materials.
Create engaging and informative content based on current trends and events related to the wellness industry.
Social Media Management:
Manage and maintain our social media platforms, including but not limited to Facebook, and Instagram.
Assist in developing a content calendar and schedule posts to ensure consistent and timely sharing of content.
Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and inquiries on social media platforms.
Analyze social media metrics and generate reports to track the effectiveness of social content.
Market Research:
Conduct market research to identify emerging trends, target audience preferences, and competitor strategies.
Stay updated on industry news, events, and developments to propose new ideas and strategies.
Digital Marketing Support:
Support various digital marketing initiatives and advertising promotional activities, including email marketing, search engine optimization (SEO), and online advertising campaigns, and websites.
Assist in tracking and analyzing website traffic and user behavior using tools such as Google Analytics.
Contribute to brainstorming sessions and provide creative input for marketing campaigns.
Generate meeting reports and presentation slides for management meetings.
Manage and update database and customer relationship management systems (CRM).
Assist in marketing events.
Requirements
A creator, observer, sharp-witted communicator with an eye for aesthetics.
Interest in health & wellness, F&B and lifestyle.
Solid understanding of different marketing techniques and familiarity with social media platforms, content creation tools (CapCut, Canva, etc), and digital marketing software (MailChimp).
Basic knowledge of photography, videography, and video editing software is preferred.
Familiarity with social media analytics and web analytics tools is a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and knowledge of MS Office and G Suite
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with an excellent command of English.
Ability to multitask, organized, proactive, and able to work both independently and as part of a team.
Highly motivated, open, with a flexible mindset and ability to work in a dynamic startup environment.
Benefits
Competitive package
Flexibility of working from home
Four day work week

title: Business Analyst Intern
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
LiT Strategy is a boutique strategy consulting firm which specialises in providing consulting services to SMEs to drive decision making. We provide SMEs with quality business advisory services to help them alleviate their pain points and seize business opportunities.

We are looking for University undergraduates to join our team as a Business Analyst Intern. This is a 6-month full-time internship.

Primary Roles & Responsibilities:
Support engagement teams to develop business strategies and business plans for existing/new businesses
Liaise with clients (Up to C-Suite) to identify areas of improvements and providerecommendations for growth

The Ideal Candidate Should:

Possess good communication, analytical and problem-solving skills with strong skills in Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Excel

Due to the high volume of applicants, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Internal Auditor (12 months)
company_info: SCOR SERVICES ASIA-PACIFIC PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Duration: 12 months Temporary contract

Work involves leading and conducting internal audit assignments, follow up, and projects, under the direction from the Deputy Head Group Internal Audit, and, as agreed with the Deputy Head/ Supervisor, supports the supervision tasks during the audit assignment fieldwork.
This involves complex and professional level internal auditing work and maintaining all organizational and professional ethical standards.
SCOR has one Group Internal Audit (GIA) located in Paris, Zurich, New York, London, and Singapore. GIA Singapore performs audit assignments primarily for Life, P&C and general operations, based in the Asia Pacific region (including Singapore, Beijing, Hong-Kong, Seoul, Sydney, Tokyo, Mumbai).

Key duties and responsibilities
Performs audit procedures subject to the Deputy Head supervision:
Based on the assignment objectives, develops the audit strategy and preliminary risk assessment, and audit work program
As part of the audit scope defined, analyse how risks are being mitigated and identify related issues and their components: criteria, conditions, causes, consequences, corrective actions i.e., recommendations, by reviewing processes, procedures and systems, testing transactions and analysing results and supporting evidence and documenting the audit working papers accordingly,
Communicates the audit results via oral presentation and written correspondence and reports, to management.
Have the ability to lead and supervise of the other auditors assigned, and reviews the accuracy, quality and completeness of the work and deliverables produced.
Participates to the works related to the recommendations follow-up.
Throughout the assignments and as part of the department’s activities:
Acquires and maintains the holistic view and an understanding of the internal audit role in the company’s governance, risk, compliance and internal control framework.
Contributes to internal discussions related to the annual audit plan on the region as triggered by the Deputy Head.
Assist Deputy Head in managing audit timeline and continuous improvement in GIA methodology, reporting and use of audit tools/ data analytics.
Develops and maintains productive objective relationships with stakeholders and team members, aligned with the role of GIA and with a mindset to add value, through individual contacts and group meetings.
Develop initiative and judgement under general supervision of the Deputy Head
Commits to pursue professional development opportunities, including external and internal training and professional association memberships, and shares information gained with co-workers.
Experience:
Significant audit experience (> 5 years) with a multinational company, preferably within insurance / reinsurance, bank/ financial sector and/or audit firm.
Personal competencies / Soft skills:
Keep abreast of relevant corporate and professional topics, and deep understanding of SCOR’s strategy, organization, business and operations
Strong verbal and written communication skills, language Skills (English is a must, additional language skills in Mandarin/ Korean are beneficial.)
Ability to understand complex business processes and interactions, good capacity to analyse risks by considering both the strategy adopted by the company and the business environment and exercising judgment when taking decisions / alerting the supervisors.
Ability to organize the audit steps executions pragmatically, timely, efficiently and independently, maintaining the required quality level in analysis and working papers documentation, and supervise internal auditors’ part of the assignment. Existing experience in IT audits / Data Analytics is beneficial.
Ability to articulate and write accurate, clear, and complete deliverables (work papers, audit reports, follow-up reports).
Highest degree of ethics and integrity.
Skill to communicate openly and clearly, verbally and in writing and readiness to hold challenging discussions, and to suggest recommendations and assess corresponding management action plans.
Digital competencies:
Microsoft Suit (incl. Excel, Worlds, PowerPoint) Data Analytics (IDEA or equivalent)
Required Education
University degree in Accounting/Finance, Actuarial, Audit, IT, Risk Management / Compliance or other related industry. Pursuit of certifications such as CIA, CPA, CISA, and other relevant credentials related industry.

title: Copywriter Intern (Remote)
company_info: Sqkii - n. (skwee - kee) : A company that solves real-world problems by mobilising crowds through gamification. To learn more about our culture and story, head over to https://sqkii.com/our-culture
address: ENTREPRENEUR BUSINESS CENTRE, 18 KAKI BUKIT ROAD 3 415978
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Want to role-play as a mouse, a rooster, and every other thing under the sun?
We’ve got an opening.

Sqkii is known for our flagship #HuntTheMouse campaign that gives away cold, hard cash to players who find hidden coins. If you’ve seen Singaporeans squatting in random spots, walking around with metal detectors, or sticking their heads under tables… you’ve probably seen one of our games in action. Besides our hunts, we also create custom games that bring players on other real life adventures and virtual journeys through their mobile screens — they’re also super cool, just ask the mouse.

Right now, we’re bringing #HuntTheMouse beyond the shores of Singapore to other cities across Asia-Pacific. We visited 5 cities in just Q2 2023 alone, and oh boy do we have big plans ahead. Big plans = bigger team, so we’re on the hunt (ha) for someone who wants to hop onto this thrilling ride.

As our Copywriter Intern, you’ll join our storytellers in bringing games to life through a variety of personas. Aside from being the voices of our games and developing narratives, you’ll also get to dabble in stuff like treasure hunts and social media copywriting. We’re open to ideas from literally anyone in the team, so be prepared to go wild, challenge, and be challenged on this journey. If you’re creative, attentive, and can conjure worlds with just your pen (or keyboard), we would absolutely love to meet you.

By the way, you’ll be working with our Operations Lead and the rest of our content and design team to deliver our tales in the best ways possible. They’re a friendly bunch and they love stories, so hit us up with your best ones — send over any creative writing samples you have when applying!

P.S. After you’ve applied, we’ll send over some secret tasks for you to try your hand at before we arrange for a virtual chat!

What you’ll be doing:
Creating clear and compelling copy to best meet the stakeholders’ objectives
Producing engaging gameplay and UI copy that excite our players
Developing effective social media marketing copy to deliver content to Sqkii’s player base and beyond
Acting as the guardian of Sqkii’s brand voice and those of our clients’ across different games and marketing campaigns
What you’ll need:
To be a current student at local public polytechnics or universities
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Excellent attention to detail and a high degree of self-motivation
Creativity and the ability to understand and respond to clients’ needs
Confidence in your own abilities
Language proficiency in Mandarin and/or Malay is a plus
Commitment for at least three months, though the internship period is flexible

title: Human Resource Intern (Generalist)
company_info: NEO GROUP LIMITED – No.1 Events Caterer in Singapore (ranked by Euromonitor International) is an award-winning, home-grown leading food catering group established in 1992 with some of the most recognised brand names in Singapore. Its main businesses comprise 3 food catering arms namely the flagship brand Neo Garden Catering, Orange Clove Catering, Deli Hub Catering and a food retail chain of 17 Umisushi outlets offering Japanese convenience food. Neo Garden Catering, a familiar household name in buffet catering is a favourite amongst corporations and middle class households for celebratory events. Since 1992, Neo Garden Catering has served over 2 million guests at 40,000 buffet events. Orange Clove Catering, which focuses on a cross-cultural style fusing Asian and International dishes with creative interpretation, is the highly popular halal-certified choice for the mid-to-up market clientele, corporations and wedding couples. Deli Hub Catering, a popular buffet option for all inter-racial celebrations, serves delightful value-friendly, halal-certified dishes to the mass markets as well as public sector institutions. With our 6 brand promises, a competitive supply chain structure, efficient production system and clear growth strategy, our team is continuously inspired to deliver a holistic experience to any celebration. Back by a strong corporate culture, we believe our people are the most important assets of the Company and we promise an enjoyable and rewarding career with us. We seek dynamic individuals who share our vision on our expansion plans and aspire to be the best to join our fast-growing company with over 400 passionate associates.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
RESPONSIBILITIES
Support the day-to-day HR operation matters including but not limited to: pre-board, on-board new hires and employee exits.
Co-ordinate course registration, workshop/presentation preparations, survey and feedback follow-up
Provide support for internal communication, employee request and Employee Engagement activities.
Support the planning and implementation of employee well-being programs
Assist payroll processing

Currently pursuing a Degree/ Diploma in Business Management, Human Resources Management
Interested to pursue a career in HR
Proven ability to appropriately handle sensitive information required
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Self-motivated, collaborative and strong focus on service delivery, quality and efficiency
Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) is highly advantageous but not a must
Able to commit 3 months and more

title: Internal Auditor - Senior and Associate
company_info: SHARED SERVICES FOR CHARITIES LIMITED IS A CHARITY THAT HELPS CHARITIES IMPROVE THEIR GOVERNANCE AND ORGANISATIONAL EXCELLANCE. WE PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL SERVICES INCLUDING INTERNAL AUDITING AND CONSULTANCY IN THE AREAS OF GOVERNANCE, INTERNAL CONTROLS, RISK AND COMPLIANCE.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Shared Services for Charities (SSC) is expanding and invites you to join us.
Charities are important to our society and require the finest standards of service. SSC provides a combination of professional standards and qualitative appreciation of the business of not-for-profit organisations. Join our team of high performers, serve charities, sharpen your own skills and develop your career. We have openings for senior internal auditor and internal auditor.
What you do:
Conduct independent reviews and assess the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls;
Provide value adding recommendations to Client Management that will enhance and improve internal controls and operational efficiency;
Review the work of team members to ensure quality;
Prepare reports and presentation materials under managers' guidance for Client Management and Audit Committees;
Undertake other consultancy work such as risk management and PDPA review;
Assist in building client relationships.
You should be equipped with:
A bachelor's degree in Accounting or equivalent from a recognised university/institution.
Professional certifications such as CIA,CPA,CA,ACCA,CISA or equivalent professional qualifications would be an advantage.
Minimum 3 years of experience in internal auditing, IT audits or governance related services.
Experience in PDPA review and risk management will be an added advantage.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Good report writing, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Positive work attitude and good team player.
What we offer you:
Hybrid working
Opportunity to influence decision-makers at Board and Chief Executive levels.
Working directly with experienced professionals and senior resource persons who contribute at SSC.
Developing professionally in an expanding social sector.
Near to MRT
Competitive remuneration.

title: Community Management Intern (Remote)
company_info: Sqkii - n. (skwee - kee) : A company that solves real-world problems by mobilising crowds through gamification. To learn more about our culture and story, head over to https://sqkii.com/our-culture

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Want to help a mouse reach and make friends with thousands of humans?
We’ve got an opening!

Sqkii is known for our flagship #HuntTheMouse campaign that gives away cold, hard cash to players who find hidden coins. If you’ve seen Singaporeans squatting in random spots, walking around with metal detectors, or sticking their heads under tables… you’ve probably seen one of our games in action. Besides our hunts, we also create custom games that bring players on other real life adventures and virtual journeys through their mobile screens — they’re also super cool, just ask the mouse.

Right now, we’re bringing #HuntTheMouse beyond the shores of Singapore to other cities across Asia-Pacific. We visited 5 cities in just Q2 2023 alone, and oh boy do we have big plans ahead. Big plans = bigger team, so we’re on the hunt (ha) for someone who wants to hop onto this thrilling ride.

As our Community Management Intern, you’ll be trusted with growing and knowing the mouse’s human friends, i.e. Sqkii’s player community (we also call most of them “hunters”). We’re looking for someone who’s excited to talk to other humans and genuinely wants to hear them out, so that we can build even better games for everyone to enjoy. On that note, you might even find yourself playing or hosting a game or two; we’re open to any and all ideas, so if you’re convinced that having a mini-game with our hunters will liven things up, well, why not?
In fact, if you’ve got an idea swimming around now... Our Operations team is more than ready to meet you. Your move.

P.S. After you’ve applied, we’ll send over some secret tasks for you to try your hand at before we arrange for a virtual chat!

Familiarity with social media platforms and their communities, including Telegram, Facebook, Instagram
High empathy and a people-oriented mindset

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Find Out Even More At: https://tinyurl.com/mindflex-intern
Hi! Our company is looking for Polytechnic/University Interns who are able to commit for a Full-Time Internship of 3 Months & Above (longer durations preferred).
About Us:
MindFlex Education's internship programme aims to provide internships that are fulfilling, as well as practical in real-world situations
Our office culture is fun, young & encouraging. We take our work, as well as our play seriously
We provide full-time job opportunities for interns who have excelled in their internship
Enjoy a cosy office environment with modern facilities such as a PS5, pool table, karaoke system & more

Be actively involved with Business & Marketing Operations of an Educational Agency on a day-to-day basis
Communicate well with new clients (warm leads), engaging them & helping them to understand better their tuition needs
Prepare client's requirements & present them in an attractive yet concise job-post format for tutors to apply in
Be in charge of filtering & broadcasting available tuition assignments via the company's various outreach channels (WhatsApp, Telegram, Email & many more)

Actively involved in active link-building and outreach campaigns to improve company's internet presence
Assist with content creation on company's website through web building tools such as WordPress

Current Polytechnic/University Student, Singaporean
Good Command of Both Written & Verbal English

Organized and Good Administrative Skills

Polite, Patient and Calm Personality

4 Weekdays, 1 Weekend, 9.00am - 6.30pm
(Working days of your choosing & mutually agreed with the company)
Strictly No Overtime and No Bring-Work-Home Culture

$800/Month (Polytechnic)
$1,000/Month (University)
Why Choose Us:
Fun Company Culture and Working Environment
Casual Working Attire, Relaxed Setting
Close-Knit Team of 15-20 Pax
Office with Modern Facilities (Pool Table, Playstation 5, Karaoke Set, Board Games, etc)
Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities

New Bright Hill MRT at Doorstep

1. Earliest Available Start-Date for Internship
2. Available Duration for Internship
3. Suitable Profile Picture of Yourself
4. Is Undertaking The Internship for A Course Requirement, or Self-Improvement
Others:

title: Analyst / Associate Manager, International Projects
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for an Analyst/ Associate Manager to join us in the International Projects team within Changi Airports International. As an Analyst/ Associate Manager, you will have the opportunity to work with our team of consultants and value partners who provide professional and consultancy services to client airports in the following functional areas:
Forecasting & Economics
Traffic Development
Non-Aeronautical Commercial
Airport Operations
Planning and Engineering
This role will start with an initial focus on Forecasting & Economics work, supporting transactions, asset management and third-party consulting with data science, economic modelling and analysis. This will involve tackling a range of aviation-centred economics questions, ranging from passenger forecasts for CAI assets to optimal commercial rent pricing for external clients. Alongside strong quantitative and programming skills, you must also excel in written and verbal communication, allowing them to explain complex concepts clearly and accessibly.

This role will also have the opportunity to engage cross-functionally with Traffic Development, Non-Aero Commercial, Operations, Engineering and Corporate Finance colleagues in delivery of their work. You can expect to be cross-trained to take on Traffic Development, Commercial, Airport Operations-related projects as part of your career growth and be developed as a well-rounded airport professional over time.

Responsibilities:
Conduct macroeconomic research and analysis to support risk-profiling and financial assessment of potential or current airport investments.
Develop econometric forecasts of traffic and other relevant aviation metrics for investments or third-party clients.
Partner colleagues with expertise in adjacent functional areas and draw on other CAI assets to gather relevant datasets for tactical data mining.
Build data products, frameworks and pipelines which modularise analysis for speed and replicability.
Undertake and support consultancy work assignments involving due diligence, benchmarking, risk assessment, business model evaluation and financial modelling across multiple functional areas
Work with project teams to support the project implementation strategies across functional areas traffic development, non-aero commercial and airport operations
Requirements:
At least a 2nd Upper Hons Bachelors or Masters Degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics or other quantitative subjects. A minor in Economics with undergraduate economic theory and econometrics is the minimum requirement.
At least 2 years hands-on experience using R, Python or other open-source statistical programming languages with various datasets, alongside core statistical and machine learning packages.
Familiarity with tools across the data value chain from SQL to Jupyter and Power BI/Tableau.
Proficient with the Microsoft Office suite and adjacent plugins, specifically advanced Excel, PowerPoint and think-cell.
Excellent written and verbal communication and ability to explain economic concepts and statistical results clearly, as evidenced from past work or research.
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. By submitting an application or your resume to us, you are consenting to the collection, use and disclosure of the submitted personally identifiable data. We collect and use personal data (including name, address, telephone number and email address) submitted by you for a variety of reasons, including for evaluating job applications, processing information requests, and internal record-keeping of our communications with you. Further information on our Personal Data Policy can be found at www.cai.sg.

title: Associate Director of Parent Relations and Internal Communications
company_info: XCL World Academy is an international school in Singapore for students aged 2 to 18, fully committed to the academic, emotional and social development of its students. XCL World Academy is a part of XCL Education’s network of award-winning international schools serving thousands of students across South East Asia.We are a truly international school with a cohort representing over 60 nationalities. We provide an outstanding international education consisting of four International Baccalaureate® (IB) programmes united by the IB’s philosophy and approaches to teaching and learning. job_category: Education and Training, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
XCL World Academy is seeking to recruit a dynamic and positive-minded Associate Director of Parent Relations & Internal Communications.
The Associate Director of Parent Relations and Internal Communications (DOPRE) holds oversight for all aspects of how the schools develop and execute strategies for internal communications, parent satisfaction and advocacy. Work in conjunction with the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) and Chief Executive Officer, XCL Singapore School (CEO), the DOPRE helps develop and implement referral and retention strategies to attract and retain students for both XWA and XAA. The ideal candidate should be an experienced customer-focused team player who brings enthusiasm and a proactive mindset.
Main Responsibilities:
A) Parent Relations
● Be the school’s first point of contact for the PEACC (Parent Engagement and Connection Committee) / PTO (Parent Teacher Organisation). Responsible for maintaining effective communication with existing parents, handling queries and being the liaison between other school personnel and departments.
● Maintain open lines of communication with existing parents to ensure their concerns, complaints and compliments feedback are handled effectively, efficiently and in a timely manner.
● Lead communication on all aspects of the parent portal.
● Oversee and lead parent forums, ensuring that we provide accurate and useful information to parents in an appropriate manner.
● Coordinating school tours for Parent Ambassadors and events.
● Encourage and support the parent community to be active advocates for word-of-mouth referrals in supporting student recruitment.
● Advise and guide the Principal on all aspects related to parent satisfaction and experience.
● Oversee the parent’s involvement in The Ambassador Platform (TAP) on the website and Parent Ambassador Programmes.
● Responsible for running the front desk day-to-day operations, ensuring quality and standard, and leading by example.
● Supervises, supports, trains, and ensures front desk staff are informed of current activities.
● Handle any parent and visitor’s feedback and requests and satisfy their needs within acceptable guidelines.
● To offer communications support to all school events, as and when required.
B) Internal Communications
● Develop an internal communications strategy that supports the school's mission and operational needs.
● Leading the development of internal communications strategy that supports the schools' mission and operational needs.
● Leading the rolling out of the internal communication strategy with the buy-in of key stakeholders, will be vital in moving the schools’ communications forward in a meaningful and coherent.
● Working closely with the Head of marketing ensuring that a coherent message runs through all school communication.
● Day to day, the role will deliver key internal communications activities in collaboration with leaders of the schools, Marketing, Admissions and Registrar and Academic Teams.
● Accountable for the delivery of the internal communications plan, acting as coordinator for the key communication areas and working in collaboration with the various school functions to ensure consistency of message and content alignment.
● Co-oversee the production of newsletters for parents and responsible for distribution.
● Providing editorial support where required to ensure consistency of message.
C) Retention
● Develop and implement customer retention strategies to increase loyalty and retain families by analysing parents’ feedback, survey results and implement retention strategies.

Person Specifications
● Minimum Degree and above in Mass Communications, Public Relations, or Business Administration or in any other relevant area.
● 5 years of experience in marketing and communications experience.
● Excellent command of the English language with strong writing skills and style.
● Superb project management skills.
● Meticulous, resourceful and with a strong sense of initiative.
● Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
● Experience in working in a school environment is an added advantage.
Application
Interested applicants are welcome to apply by 12 October 2023.

About us
XCL World Academy offers a rigorous and balanced education for students aged 2 to 18, beginning with our Nursery programme and continuing through the full International Baccalaureate (IB) continuum of studies. We believe in future-proofing your child by providing relevant skills and exposure, equipping them with the skills required for the jobs of tomorrow. Through our world-class curriculum and with the guidance of highly experienced teachers, our students embark on a self-directed journey to become skilled and empathetic young individuals.
We aspire to recruit employees that share and understand our commitment towards creating our mission of empowering an international community of happy learners who aspire to positively impact others. We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people. All appointments are subject to Safer Recruitment processes such as interviews, employment reference checks, identity, and criminal record checks. Selected candidate[s] would be required to provide documentation of background checks done from the home country.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Details of the Division and Team
Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest wealth managers worldwide. We offer our clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations, we create lasting value for clients. We specialize in developing bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits.
The business are looking for a Client Service Executive to support the Relationship Managers (RMs) and Investment Managers (IMs) in the day to day servicing of clients through processing transactions, resolving account/payment problems and providing all round operational support. The role will sit in a centralized team reporting to a local manager.
What we will offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center.
You can expect:
Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services
Comprehensive leave benefits
Gender Neutral Parental Leave
Flexible working arrangements
21 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement
Your key responsibilities
Support Private Banker to provide excellent service to high net-worth clients so as to achieve client retention, and be able to handle daily business-as-usual tasks within the desk and market
Understanding of all desk administration and ability to manage the meetings and travel arrangements of Private Bankers
Understand client requirements and assist Private Bankers in daily maintenance of account relationships
Act as the client key interface over initiation of clients' instructions, monitor funds for payment, prepare clients' fax instructions, forms and loan disbursement instruction
Ability to understand issues and appropriately escalate to Management in a timely fashion
Develop good understanding of the governing regulatory framework, including but not limited to applicable confidentiality/secrecy/data protection regulations and cross border rules where relevant
Your skills and experience
At least 3-5 years of relevant client service executive or assistant relationship manager experience at Associate level for the South East Asia market
Working experience from Private Banking or Wealth Management business is a must.
Relevant local licenses and qualifications such as CACS Paper 1 and 2 is a must.
Strong team player, also able to meet tight deadlines and multi-task
Self-motivated and goal orientated and a ‘can do’ personality, who is able to work in a high paced environment
Fluent (written and oral) in English
Meticulous, methodical and concise, with a strong attention to detail
Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirement may apply.
How we’ll support you
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
Training and development to help you excel in your career
About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network. Click here to see what we do.
Deutsche Bank & Diversity
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.
We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.
Visit Inside Deutsche Bank to discover more about the culture of Deutsche Bank including Diversity, Equity & Inclusion, Leadership, Learning, Future of Work and more besides.

title: Intern, AML Compliance
company_info: iFAST Corporation Ltd is a financial services company with operations spanning across Singapore, Malaysia, Hong Kong and India. In Singapore, iFAST is Singapore’s leading unit trust distributor. iFAST provides an integrated investment administration platform offering a comprehensive range of services including dealing, investment administration, research support and other services to more than 50 independently-owned financial advisory companies and financial institutions, and over 2,500 financial adviser representatives. Its subsidiary, iFAST Financial Pte Ltd is a holder of Capital Markets Services License and Financial Adviser's License issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore, and is a CPF-registered Investment Administrator. iFAST Financial also operates its distribution arm, Fundsupermart.com, an online unit trust and SGS bonds distribution. iFAST Corp was awarded the 2nd position in Enterprise 50 (E50) Awards in 2008. In December 2010, iFAST was presented with the Business Superbrands Award 2010 in Singapore. The Singapore Business Superbrands programme recognises the country’s strongest business to business brands. You may read more about us at www.ifastcorp.com , www.ifastfinancial.com , www.fundsupermart.com.
job_category: Accounting / Auditing / Taxation, Banking and Finance, Risk Management
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Assist the AML Compliance department to implement and maintain robust framework for AML/CFT compliance reviews to assess the implementation of applicable rules and regulations
Keep abreast of AML/CFT regulatory changes and provide timely dissemination of regulatory updates to ensure that the business units and relevant departments are aware of the latest rules and regulations
Facilitate AML/CFT training materials and conduct regular trainings to all staff
Additional/ ad-hoc duties may be assigned when required
Requirements
Independent, driven, resourceful and meticulous
High sense of responsibility and integrity
Strong interpersonal and analytical skills
Duration of internship flexible (minimum 3 months)

title: Content Marketing Intern
company_info: PALO IT is a global innovation consultancy specialised in human-centered design, Agile software development and in the AI-driven transformation of large, forward-thinking companies. As a community of innovators, designers and technologists, we are committed to helping businesses embrace tech as a force for good. We work with clients to rapidly launch products and services, create new business models, and prepare leadership and culture for the future. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices across five continents, we are proud to be a B-Corp certified company in Singapore (the first tech company to do so!) and Hong Kong, and working towards certification across all other locations. To further our vision of bringing positive change to better our world, we are looking for a new team member to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, your happiness is our success. People are the heart of our organisation and the centre of everything we do. We constantly strive to provide the best employee experience, as well as cultivate a diverse, inclusive and multicultural work environment, with many opportunities where you grow professionally and personally.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it.
Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong, Bangkok and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore.
At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more!
Our Vision and Values
We aspire to positively impact the world by empowering organizations to harness the power of transformative technology for the greater good.
We care about our World
We act with Courage
We Share, it’s in our DNA
We choose Positivity
We Deliver Awesomeness
Your Profile & Role
YOU:
Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed?
Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?
Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?
Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?

YOU AGAIN:
Self-motivated with a results-driven approach
Passionate about generative AI, Web3, modernisation of tech stacks, sustainability innovations as new ways to do business
Ability to think in a customer-centric and user-driven way
Able to work independently, multi-task and manage pressure
Has a high level of professionalism, work ethic, and honesty
Able to conduct user and market research
Identify as a content creator; able to write and design
Basic knowledge about Google Search for content discovery and Hubspot (CRM) for content marketing
Good working knowledge of design and video production tools (Eg. Adobe suite, Premier Pro, Figma, Notion, Canva..etc)

YOUR ROLE:
Partner our creative lead to conceptualize, produce, and edit marketing assets for email marketing, LinkedIn, YouTube and possibly Instagram. Assets would typically include brochures, infographics, email newsletters, presentation decks, carousel social posts, short form videos amongst others.
Research and identify key content and social media trends that would be relevant in driving fresh ways to approach social content against technology buyers and key opinion leaders.
Support in partnership collaborations with tech influencers, brands, and media outreach
Assist in producing keynote events with cross functional teams
Administrative support and any ad-hoc duties as assigned
Position is based in Singapore for a minimum of 3 months

title: Intern - Maintenance & Engineering
company_info: Linde Gas Singapore Pte Ltd (LGS) is the operations base of The Linde Group's business in Singapore. Located on Jurong Island, which is one of the world's top ten petrochemical hubs, the unit was incorporated in 2004 when Linde AG acquired Singapore Syngas Pte Ltd. LGS is a leading industrial gas supplier in Singapore. Our deep local knowledge, combined with global expertise and resources in the areas of technology, research & development, gas applications, engineering and best operating practices, enables us to provide total gas solutions to a variety of industries.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Support for Plant start-up with Technical Data compilation and Evaluation for Inspection/Static/Rotating Equipment for HPU Plant.
Assist in compiling and preparation of Statutory/Static/Rotating Equipment Master list
Support in extracting GAs/vendor packages/Supplier datasheet from GDMS
Aid in extracting mechanical technical data from GA drawings and MDR
Assist in Formulating Comprehensive Technical data list for Equipment and Piping
Assistance in preparing technical documentation for RBI Assessment in PSAIM
Support in preparing BOM for rotating equipment to incorporate into SAP
Contributing to prepare complete equipment listing for HPU Plant
Underpinning for preparation of technical parameters sheet as per API 571 Damage Mechanisms
Learning Outcomes
Complying and Understanding safety requirements of the process industry.
Be conversant with basics of plant process, reliability, Maintenance strategy as well as reliability centred maintenance plan.
Acquaintance to understand mechanical drawings, Fabrication and QA/QC details
Familiarization with GA drawings and manufacturing data records for equipment
Able to interpret drawings of different types of mechanical equipment (both static and rotating)
Learning fundamentals and basics of Damage Mechanisms
Gaining overview of RBI assessment and its purpose
Understanding functions of various departments in the project site
Collaborate and work with diverse group with varied experience & knowledge
Job Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Mechanical Engineering.
Comfortable to travel to Jurong Island, shuttle bus will be provided at Boon Lay.
Able to commit for the duration from 8 Jan 2024 to 24 May 2024.

title: Intern (Warehouse & Logistic)
company_info: About Phoon Huat Founded in 1947 Redman/Phoon Huat is a well established household name in Singapore associated with baking, over multiple generations. As an industry leader, we serve Food Service establishments (B2B: hotels, restaurants, bakery, food manufacturers, wholesale , hawker, etc.) directly as well the baking enthusiasts/shoppers (B2C) thru our retail stores across the island and e-commerce www.redmanshop.com with a wide variety of products: Baking ingredients, dairy products, nuts, fillings, fats & oils, groceries, baking utensils/non-food items. We also have an Export division developing our business overseas. Leveraging on a global network of partners, Phoon Huat brings in quality and best value ingredients from all corners of the globe. We value providing solutions using new food concept innovations and have expanded our product range to include premium meats, seafood and gourmet fine foods. For more information about the history of the company please visit our website www.phoonhuat.com. PH had acquired Le Petit Depot ( LPD) the online French grocer.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
Participate in the Data Audit, assisting in reviewing and refining data accuracy.
Provide support in the rollout of our new Transportation Management System, engaging in data migration and staff training.
Assist with periodic inventory cycle counts, analysing discrepancies and improving counting processes.
Collaborate in the identification and verification of Idle stock in our inventory.
Learn about and contribute to operational process mapping, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Support regular warehouse operations and tasks as needed.
Engage in continuous improvement projects and initiatives, aiming to streamline our processes.
Prepare and assist in creating regular reports and analyses on various warehouse logistics operations.
Activities:
Material Master Data Audit Comprehensive review of Material Master data with a focus on carton barcode, weight, and volume.
TMS Rollout Support Assisting in the implementation and familiarization of the new Transportation Management System.
Inventory Cycle Counting Periodic validation of inventory records through physical counting.
Dead Stock Analysis Identification and analysis of non-moving inventory items.
Operational Process Enhancement Mapping existing processes and recommending improvements based on best practices.
Estimated Time Line for above activities:
Weeks 1-2 Orientation and Initial Planning & Training
Weeks 3-4 Material Master Data Audit
Weeks 5-6 Assisting with TMS Rollout
Week 7-8 Periodic Inventory Cycle Counting
Week 9 Dead Stock Identification
Weeks 10-11 Operational Process Mapping
Week 12 Final Report and Presentation

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Accounts Officer / Accounts Executive

Working Time: Monday to Friday, 8.30am – 6pm
Working Location: Haw Par Villa (Nearest MRT)
Salary: $3200 - $3600

Overview and Objective of the Position
The Accounts Officer is responsible for student financial management and providing accounts support to the Commercial Finance Manager UPA.
Job Duties:

1. Student Financial Management
Responsible for processing all student receipts and refunds.
Responsible for updating the receipt batch and prepare the necessary paperwork for banking and filing purposes.
Reviewing student files for action.
Management of sponsored students’ financial transactions with the sponsors.
Management of bursaries and scholarships and other student awards in student’s financial transactions.
2. Bank Reconciliation
Assist with the preparation of the bank reconciliation of all bank accounts
3. General ledger
Raise general ledger payments, receipts and journals as directed.
Assist with preparation of regular general ledger reconciliations.
4. Fee Protection Scheme (FPS) insurance management
Assisting with the maintenance of Fee Protection Scheme insurance, including purchasing and cancelling of FPS policies
Monitor the validity and expiry of FPS policies to ensure there is no lapse in FPS protection
Dealing with enquiries from stakeholders via various modes of communication in a timely and professional manner
5. General Duties
Relieve/assist the other members of the finance team as required
Ensure documentation is maintained in an orderly fashion
Provide administrative relief when required during busy periods
Provide excellent internal and external customer service to colleagues, staff from organisations, students and customers at all times.
An understanding of and commitment to school’s Quality Policy and Practices, and Occupational Health and Safety Policy and Practices.
Other duties as required under the supervision of the Finance Manager
Job Requirements:
Diploma in Account / relevant discipline
Preferable with experience in dealing with International Students.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Student and Academic Services Officer

Working Time: Monday to Friday, 8.30am – 6pm
Working Location: Haw Par Villa (Nearest MRT)
Salary: $3000 - $3800

Overview for the role:
The Student and Academic Services Officer is to provide extensive administration support to academic staff and maintain the applicable academic systems for the school

Job Duties:

1. Academic Staff
-Prepare and maintain sessional academic staff employment contracts.
-Organise and maintain academic staff contact details, network accounts and systems access.
-Ensure academic staff have access to required equipment and resources.
-Obtain necessary teaching approval for academic staff.
-Maintain records of qualifications and CVs of academic staff.
-Register academic staff details through online systems to maintain CPE registration of academic staff.
-Check sessional academic staff teaching claims for submission to Finance for processing.
-Assist in planning and organising Professional Development workshops for academic staff.

2. Students Systems Management
-Assist in planning and organising Professional Development workshops for academic staff.
-Manage students’ record and update students’ status on Student Management systems to ensure accuracy of record and academic status.
-Advise students on course requirements.
-Assist with enrolment of new and continuing students.
-Provide support and assist students with academic enquiries.
-Identify students in need of academic skills support and refer them to relevant support class.
-Monitor academic progress to identify students at risk.
-Process course variation applications and provide relevant academic counselling to students relating to the study plan.
-Organise and conduct student academic advising session and briefing when required.
-Ensure student academic progress is in accordance with regulations.
-Provide support at Student Connect.

3. Students' Contracts and Student’s Pass Management
-Process student pass renewal application and student pass cancellation for each study period on SOLAR+
-Monitor the validity and expiry of student passes and other types of passes for non-citizens
-Maintain records of the application, payment, approval, and collection of student pass
-Ensure all student pass changes have relevant approvals in line with policy
-Maintain procedures manual for the management of student pass
-Assisting with the preparation and checking of student contracts
-Execute student contracts in accordance with the procedures and in line with policy

4. Course Planning and Delivery
_Assist in planning of units offering for each study period for all programs.
-Manage and update student study plans each study period for all programs.
-Assist in the development of the academic timetable for each study period in consultation with Director of Academic Services and academic staff.
-Prepare timetable in the Student Management System and setup for students’ class registration.
-Manage students’ class registration via the Student Management System.
-Support the class monitoring process to ensure they are taking place in accordance with the timetable and keep records of any changes.
-Ensure that the class sizes are viable after enrolment is finalised.
-Support academic staff for course delivery requirement.
-Support lesson observation as part of quality management.
-Assist in planning and organising Study Skills workshops for students.
-Maintain up to date knowledge of course structures and academic policies and procedures.

5. Attendance System Management

-Manage the attendance system and liaise with the vendor to ensure the system is operating effectively.
-Ensure that information (e.g. student enrolment and timetable details) on the attendance system is up to date and accurate.
-Monitor the captured attendance records and review the accuracy of the data captured against scheduled timetable.
-Prepare relevant reports from attendance records to facilitate the monitoring of attendance requirements, including identifying students at risk.
-Prepare student attendance records for submission to Immigration & Checkpoints Authority for the purpose of Student’s Pass applications.
-Process students’ absence justification requests and lecturers’ manual attendance requests.
-Process attendance appeals.
-Coordinate and facilitate staff training sessions on the attendance system.
-Coordinate and facilitate the capturing of students’ bio data.

6. Academic Support
-Meet and provide counselling with students who do not meet attendance requirements.
-Provide support and assist students with academic enquiries.
-Provide support at Student Connect.
-Prepare the daily classroom schedules on the display monitors and maintain the locations where classroom schedules are displayed.
-Support academic staff for course delivery requirement.
-Assist in preparation of class lists.
-Manage students and teaching staff surveys including the creation of the surveys, results compilation and analysis.

7. Others
-Plan and implement student and academic staff surveys.
-Prepare and analyze academic data and reports for Management.
-Ad-hoc tasks assigned as and when required by Associate Director of Academic Services

Job Requirements:

-Diploma in Business Administration / relevant discipline
-Preferable with experience in dealing with International Students.

description:

Working Location: Haw Par Villa (Nearest MRT)

Overview and Objective of the Position
The Accounts Officer is responsible for student financial management and providing accounts support to the Commercial Finance Manager UPA.

Responsible for processing all student receipts and refunds.
Responsible for updating the receipt batch and prepare the necessary paperwork for banking and filing purposes.

Provide excellent internal and external customer service to colleagues, staff from organisations, students and customers at all times.
